original: de dag las padma sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog lta bu dang; me'i kha dog lta bu dang / gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang / che khyad shing rta'i 'phang lo tsam dag skye ste /
analyzed: de dag las padma sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog lta bu dang; me'i kha dog lta bu dang / gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang / che khyad shing rta'i 'phang lo tsam dag skye ste /
translated: There are blue, yellow, red, white, and pink lotuses, as well as lotuses the color of crystal, the color of fire, and the color of gold, some of which are as large as chariot wheels.

original: de dag bcad na dri ngad phyogs bzhi kun du dpag tshad tsam du ldang ngo //
analyzed: de dag bcad na dri ngad phyogs bzhi kun du dpag tshad tsam du ldang ngo //
translated: When they are cut, their fragrance spreads in all directions for a full league.

original: ri'i rgyal po de'i rtse mo la padma'i gdan chen po aan da rnyil gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa rdo rje lta bu'i chu ba can /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po de'i rtse mo la padma'i gdan chen po aan da rnyil gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa rdo rje lta bu'i chu ba can /
translated: On the peak of that king of mountains there is a great lotus seat made of sapphire, with a vajra stem,

original: bee d'ur+ya chen pos mtha' bskor ba /
analyzed: bee d'ur+ya chen pos mtha' bskor ba /
translated: surrounded by great beryl,

original: dzambu chu bo'i gser dri ma med pa'i 'dab ma rgyas pa /
analyzed: dzambu chu bo'i gser dri ma med pa'i 'dab ma rgyas pa /
translated: with petals of stainless gold from the Jambū River,

original: tsan dan dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i snying po rnam par dag pa rin po che'i rdo'i snying po'i ze ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tsan dan dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i snying po rnam par dag pa rin po che'i rdo'i snying po'i ze ba dang ldan pa /
translated: It was surrounded by a garland of the anthers of a pure, precious stone, the essence of which followed the sandalwood season.

original: tshad rgya mtsho ltar yangs shing rgya che ba /
analyzed: tshad rgya mtsho ltar yangs shing rgya che ba /
translated: It was as vast and wide as the ocean.

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po sa yas snying po kun tu bzung ba /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po sa yas snying po kun tu bzung ba /
translated: It was held by the essence of a hundred thousand lords of the asuras.

original: nor bu rin po che sa ya'i dra ba sna tshogs kyis g-yogs pa /🔽klu'i dbang po sa yas sprin las spos chu'i char phab pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che sa ya'i dra ba sna tshogs kyis g-yogs pa / klu'i dbang po sa yas sprin las spos chu'i char phab pa /
translated: It was covered by a net of a hundred thousand precious jewels.🔽It was rained on by a cloud of a hundred thousand lords of the nāgas.

original: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po sa yas mkha' nas dar dpyangs shing ri mo byas pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po sa yas mkha' nas dar dpyangs shing ri mo byas pa /
translated: It was hung with silk canopies and banners by a hundred thousand lords of the garuḍas.

original: mi'am ci'i dbang po sa yas phan pa'i sems kyis blta ba /🔽lto 'phye chen po'i dbang pos ya sa yas gdong gis phyag 'tshal @5b cing ri mo byas pa /
analyzed: mi'am ci'i dbang po sa yas phan pa'i sems kyis blta ba / lto 'phye chen po'i dbang pos ya sa yas gdong gis phyag 'tshal @5b cing ri mo byas pa /
translated: It was looked at with a helpful mind by a hundred thousand lords of the kinnaras.🔽It was bowed to and honored by a hundred thousand lords of the mahoragas.

original: dri za'i dbang po sa yas bstod cing bsngags la mchod pa /
analyzed: dri za'i dbang po sa yas bstod cing bsngags la mchod pa /
translated: It was praised, extolled, and worshiped by a hundred thousand lords of the gandharvas.

original: lha'i dbang po sa yas me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang; rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan gyi sprin gyi char phab pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po sa yas me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang; rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan gyi sprin gyi char phab pa /
translated: The lord of the gods, with a retinue of a billion, rained down a rain of flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and divine flags.

original: tshangs pa'i dbang po sa yas mgo bos phyag 'tshal zhing ri mo byas pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbang po sa yas mgo bos phyag 'tshal zhing ri mo byas pa /
translated: The lord of the Brahmās, with a retinue of a billion, bowed his head and made offerings.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu sa yas thal mo sbyar nas phyag byas pa /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu sa yas thal mo sbyar nas phyag byas pa /
translated: The gods of the pure abodes, with a retinue of a billion, joined their palms and bowed.

original: mi'i dbang po 'khor los bsgyur ba sa yas nor bu rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pas bsu ba /
analyzed: mi'i dbang po 'khor los bsgyur ba sa yas nor bu rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pas bsu ba /
translated: The lords of humans, with a retinue of a billion, welcomed him with the seven precious jewels of a cakravartin.

original: rgya mtsho'i lha sa yas bsu zhing phyag byas pa /🔽nor bu rin po che skar mdog sa yas 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa /🔽bsod nams kyis dag pa'i nor bu rin po che sa yas shin tu nges par mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i lha sa yas bsu zhing phyag byas pa / nor bu rin po che skar mdog sa yas 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa / bsod nams kyis dag pa'i nor bu rin po che sa yas shin tu nges par mdzes par byas pa /
translated: The lords of the ocean, with a retinue of a billion, welcomed him and bowed.🔽The star-colored jewels, with a retinue of a billion, illuminated him with light rays.🔽The pure jewels of merit, with a retinue of a billion, made him extremely beautiful.

original: nor bu rin po che rnam par snang byed sa yas snying po dri ma med pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che rnam par snang byed sa yas snying po dri ma med pa /
translated: The jewels of the illuminating light, with a retinue of a billion, were stainless in their essence.

original: nor bu rin po che dpal gyi 'od zer sa yas dpal rab tu thal le ba /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che dpal gyi 'od zer sa yas dpal rab tu thal le ba /
translated: There were a quintillion precious jewels of glory, shining with splendor.

original: nor bu rin po che'i mdzod sna tshogs sa yas mtha' yas par snang ba /🔽nor bu rin po che dzambu'i rgyal mtshan sa yas legs par bzung bas brtan par gyur pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i mdzod sna tshogs sa yas mtha' yas par snang ba / nor bu rin po che dzambu'i rgyal mtshan sa yas legs par bzung bas brtan par gyur pa /
translated: There were a quintillion precious jewels of various treasuries, shining infinitely.🔽There were a quintillion precious jewels of the banner of Jambū, well held and firm.

original: nor bu rin po che rdo rje'i seng ge sa yas gzhan gyis mi thub par bkod pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che rdo rje'i seng ge sa yas gzhan gyis mi thub par bkod pa /
translated: There were a quintillion precious jewels of the vajra lion, arrayed to be invincible.

original: nor bu rin po che nyi ma'i snying po sa yas rgya cher spras pa /🔽nor bu rin po che bsam gyis mi khyab pa sa yas kha dog sna tshogs kyis ri mo byas pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che nyi ma'i snying po sa yas rgya cher spras pa / nor bu rin po che bsam gyis mi khyab pa sa yas kha dog sna tshogs kyis ri mo byas pa /
translated: There were a quintillion precious jewels of the essence of the sun, arrayed extensively.🔽There were a quintillion precious jewels of the inconceivable, arrayed with various colors.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che sa yas mi zad pa bkod pas ri mo byas pa byung ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che sa yas mi zad pa bkod pas ri mo byas pa byung ste /
translated: There were a quintillion precious wish-fulfilling jewels, arrayed with an inexhaustible array.

original: padma chen po de ni de bzhin @6a *//
analyzed: padma chen po de ni de bzhin @6a *//
translated: That great lotus was the Tathāgata’s,

original: gshegs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las nges par byung ba /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las nges par byung ba /
translated: arisen from roots of merit that transcend the world,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pas mnos pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pas mnos pa /
translated: accepted by the intention of a bodhisattva,

original: phyogs thams cad du mngon du go bar byed pa /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du mngon du go bar byed pa /
translated: it was understood in all directions;

original: sgyu mar gyur pa'i chos las nges par byung ba /
analyzed: sgyu mar gyur pa'i chos las nges par byung ba /
translated: it arose from illusory phenomena;

original: dri nga ba med pa'i las las skyes pa /
analyzed: dri nga ba med pa'i las las skyes pa /
translated: it was born from the karma of the absence of bad smells;

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi tshul bkod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi tshul bkod pa /
translated: it was the arrangement of the way of the nature of phenomena that is free of afflictions;

original: rmi lam lta bu'i chos nyid kyis kun tu rgyu ba /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i chos nyid kyis kun tu rgyu ba /
translated: it was pervaded by the nature of phenomena that is like a dream;

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i chos nyid kyis rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i chos nyid kyis rgyas btab pa /
translated: it was sealed by the nature of phenomena that is free of formation;

original: chags pa med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: it was endowed with nonattachment;

original: phyogs kun du chos kyi dbyings kyis khyab par byed pa /
analyzed: phyogs kun du chos kyi dbyings kyis khyab par byed pa /
translated: it pervaded the realm of phenomena in all directions;

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul rab tu brjod pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul rab tu brjod pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: and it was in accord with the expression of the domain of the buddhas.

original: de'i rnam pa dang / yon tan dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog dang / bkod pa'i mtha' ni /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang / yon tan dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog dang / bkod pa'i mtha' ni /
translated: The extent of its features, qualities, shape, color, and arrangement🔽could not be realized in countless eons.

original: bskal pa grangs med par yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i padma chen po de la bcom ldan 'das skyil mo krung bcas nas bzhugs te /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med par yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i padma chen po de la bcom ldan 'das skyil mo krung bcas nas bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was seated cross-legged on that great lotus.

original: 'di ltar dge slong brgyad stong gi dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong brgyad stong gi dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig pa la /
translated: In this way, the Blessed One was together with a great saṅgha of eight thousand monks,

original: 'di lta ste /🔽tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya dang / tshe dang ldan pa rta thul dang / tshe dang ldan pa rlangs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ming chen dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka dang / tshe dang ldan pa grags pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya dang / tshe dang ldan pa rta thul dang / tshe dang ldan pa rlangs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ming chen dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka dang / tshe dang ldan pa grags pa dang /
translated: namely:🔽the venerable Ajnata Kauṇḍinya, the venerable Aśvajit, the venerable Bāṣpa, the venerable Mahānāman, the venerable Upaga, the venerable Yaśaḥ,🔽the venerable Pūrṇa, the venerable Vimala, the venerable Gavāṃpati, the venerable Subāhu, the venerable Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the venerable Nadī-Kāśyapa,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa dri ma med dang; tshe dang ldan pa ba lang bdag dang / tshe dang ldan pa lag bzang dang / tshe dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung dang / tshe dang ldan pa chu klung 'od srung dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa dri ma med dang; tshe dang ldan pa ba lang bdag dang / tshe dang ldan pa lag bzang dang / tshe dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung dang / tshe dang ldan pa chu klung 'od srung dang /
translated: and the venerable Gayā-Kāśyapa.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ga ya 'od srung dang / tshe dang @6b ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa ka tya'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ga ya 'od srung dang / tshe dang @6b ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa ka tya'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po dang /
translated: the Venerable Gayākāśyapa, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa, the Venerable Kātyāyana, the Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa nam gru dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor dang / tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa nam gru dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor dang / tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin dang /
translated: the Venerable Aniruddha, the Venerable Subhūti, the Venerable Revata, the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, the Venerable Upāli, the Venerable Rāhula,

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa dge slong brgyad stong thams cad kyang bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa dge slong brgyad stong thams cad kyang bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa /
translated: and the Venerable Ānanda, and so forth—all eight thousand monks, who had all realized the truth,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du gyur pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du gyur pa /
translated: had directly perceived the limit of reality,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin la zhugs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin la zhugs pa /
translated: had entered the nature of phenomena,

original: srid pa'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba /
translated: had crossed the ocean of existence,

original: de bzhin nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i spyod yul ba /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i spyod yul ba /
translated: Their sphere of activity is like the sky.

original: kun du sbyor ba dang bag la nyal gyi 'ching ba bcad pa /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba dang bag la nyal gyi 'ching ba bcad pa /
translated: They have cut through the bonds of fetters and latent tendencies.

original: gnas dang rten la ma chags pa /
analyzed: gnas dang rten la ma chags pa /
translated: They are not attached to abodes and supports.

original: nam mkha' ltar zhi ba la rnam par rgyu ba /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar zhi ba la rnam par rgyu ba /
translated: They move in the peace that is like the sky.

original: sangs rgyas la nem nur dang yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba bcad pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la nem nur dang yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba bcad pa /
translated: They have cut through hesitation, doubt, and uncertainty about the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rgya mtsho la mos pa'i lam du zhugs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rgya mtsho la mos pa'i lam du zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the path of devotion to the ocean of the buddhas’ wisdom.

original: 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered in order to benefit all beings.

original: gsol ba ma btab par dge ba'i bshes gnyen byed pa /
analyzed: gsol ba ma btab par dge ba'i bshes gnyen byed pa /
translated: They are spiritual friends without being asked.

original: sems can thams cad bsrung bar zhugs pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsrung bar zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered to protect all beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i mdza' bshes su gyur pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i mdza' bshes su gyur pa /
translated: They are friends who never abandon any being.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i spyod yul las nges par byung ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i spyod yul las nges par byung ba /
translated: They have emerged from the sphere of activity of the buddhas’ teachings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa bsrung bar zhugs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa bsrung bar zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered to protect the teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa kun du 'dzin par smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa kun du 'dzin par smon lam btab pa /
translated: They have made aspirations to uphold the buddhas’ teachings.

original: de bzhin gshegs @7a *//🔽pa'i gdung rigs 'byung bar mngon du phyogs pa /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa sha stag go /🔽kun tu bzang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong dang thabs gcig pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @7a *// pa'i gdung rigs 'byung bar mngon du phyogs pa / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa sha stag go / kun tu bzang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong dang thabs gcig pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: They were all irreversible from the state of omniscience, and they were all irreversible from the family of the tathāgatas.🔽They were all irreversible from the wisdom of omniscience.🔽He was together with eight thousand bodhisattvas, such as Samantabhadra and the bodhisattva noble Mañjuśrī.🔽

original: zla ba'i bla ma'i ye shes can dang / dri ma med pa'i bla ma'i ye shes can dang / rdo rje'i ye shes can dang / rdul med ye shes can dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par snang ba'i ye shes can dang / byang chub sems dpa' snang ba'i rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: zla ba'i bla ma'i ye shes can dang / dri ma med pa'i bla ma'i ye shes can dang / rdo rje'i ye shes can dang / rdul med ye shes can dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par snang ba'i ye shes can dang / byang chub sems dpa' snang ba'i rgyal mtshan dang /
