analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pas spyod yul la thogs pa med pa //
translated: They were unimpeded in their range of activity, as they filled all buddha realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thad du 'gro bas lus mtha' yas par byin gyis rlob pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thad du 'gro bas lus mtha' yas par byin gyis rlob pa /
translated: They had the blessing of infinite bodies, going into the presence of all the tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul pa thams cad rnam par rig pas mtha' yas pa la dmigs pa'i mig gi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul pa thams cad rnam par rig pas mtha' yas pa la dmigs pa'i mig gi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa /
translated: They had the pure eye-discs that focused on the infinite, by the awareness of all the emanations of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sgor 'gro ba rgyun mi gcod pas 'gro ba tshad med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sgor 'gro ba rgyun mi gcod pas 'gro ba tshad med pa /
translated: They had infinite going, by the uninterrupted going to the door of the complete enlightenment of all tathagatas.

original: chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi tshul shes pa'i snang ba nod pas snang ba mtha' yas pa /
analyzed: chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi tshul shes pa'i snang ba nod pas snang ba mtha' yas pa /
translated: They had infinite light, by receiving the light of the knowledge of the ways of all the oceans of the Dharma.

original: so sor yang dag par rig pa rnam par dag pas bskal pa mtha' yas par yon tan mi zad par ston pa /
analyzed: so sor yang dag par rig pa rnam par dag pas bskal pa mtha' yas par yon tan mi zad par ston pa /
translated: They had the teaching of inexhaustible qualities for infinite eons, by the purity of their knowledge.

original: ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam par dag pas nam mkha'i khams kyis klas pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam par dag pas nam mkha'i khams kyis klas pa /
translated: They were as vast as the realm of space, by the purity of the sphere of their knowledge.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i lus gzugs kun tu ston pas gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i lus gzugs kun tu ston pas gnas pa med pa /
translated: They had no abode, by the manifestation of all the bodies of beings in accordance with their thoughts.

original: sems can med pa dang ldan pas dbyings yongs su shes pas rab ri ba med pa /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang ldan pas dbyings yongs su shes pas rab ri ba med pa /
translated: They were endowed with the knowledge of the realm of phenomena, which is free of pride.

original: chos kyi dbyings thams cad 'od zer gyi dra bas rgyas par 'gengs pas shes rab nam mkha' lta bu sems shin tu zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thams cad 'od zer gyi dra bas rgyas par 'gengs pas shes rab nam mkha' lta bu sems shin tu zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba /
translated: They had the space-like wisdom of the mind, which is very peaceful and completely peaceful, and they filled the entire realm of phenomena with a web of light rays.

original: gzungs kyi rigs thams cad shes pa'i yul dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzungs kyi rigs thams cad shes pa'i yul dang ldan pa /
translated: They had the domain of knowledge of all the types of dhāraṇī.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis pha rol gnon pa la 'jigs pa med pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis pha rol gnon pa la 'jigs pa med pa /
translated: They were fearless in the mastery of samādhi.

original: chos kyi dbyings gnas pa'i mthar thug pa'i mig can /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gnas pa'i mthar thug pa'i mig can /
translated: They had the eyes that see the ultimate limit of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs par gnas pa thob @10a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs par gnas pa thob @10a *//
translated: They had attained the domain of the nonapprehending nature of all phenomena.

original: pa; shes rab rgya mtsho mtha' yas pas rnam par rgyu ba /🔽ye shes dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa /
analyzed: pa; shes rab rgya mtsho mtha' yas pas rnam par rgyu ba / ye shes dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa /
translated: They moved in the infinite ocean of wisdom.🔽They had reached the perfection of sublime wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa /
translated: They had attained the perfection of wisdom.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'gro ba /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'gro ba /
translated: They had reached the perfection of miraculous powers.

original: mchog thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa /
analyzed: mchog thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa /
translated: They had reached the perfection of all that is supreme.

original: ting nge 'dzin mchog la dbang thob pa sha stag go /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mchog la dbang thob pa sha stag go /
translated: They had attained mastery of the supreme samādhi.

original: dge slong ma lnga brgya dang yang thabs gcig pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma lnga brgya dang yang thabs gcig pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: He was also accompanied by five hundred nuns, such as:

original: go'u ta m'i skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo dang / dge slong ma bde ma dang / dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog dang / dge slong ma go'u ta m'i skem mo dang / sgra gcan zin gyi ma dge slong ma grags 'dzin la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya dang thabs gcig go /
analyzed: go'u ta m'i skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo dang / dge slong ma bde ma dang / dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog dang / dge slong ma go'u ta m'i skem mo dang / sgra gcan zin gyi ma dge slong ma grags 'dzin la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya dang thabs gcig go /
translated: Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, the nun Kṣemā, the nun Utpalavarnā, the nun Gautamī, the nun Kṣemā, and Yaśodharā, the mother of Rāhula.

original: dge bsnyen lnga brgya tsam dang yang thabs gcig pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen lnga brgya tsam dang yang thabs gcig pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: He was also accompanied by about five hundred male lay followers, such as:🔽Bhadraśrī, Bhūmiśrī, Prajñāprabha, Yaśaḥśrī, Yaśottaraśrī, Sumati, Śaśivṛṣabha, Candrapriya, Mahāpriya,

original: dge bsnyen gzi brjid bzang po dang / sa'i gzi brjid dang / shes rab 'od dang / grags pa'i gzi brjid dang / grags pa mchog gi gzi brjid dang / blo gros bzang dang / zla ba'i dpal dang / zla ba dga' dang / cher dga' dang /🔽sgra gcan bzang dang / cher bzang la sogs pa dge bsnyen lnga brgya dang thabs gcig go /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gzi brjid bzang po dang / sa'i gzi brjid dang / shes rab 'od dang / grags pa'i gzi brjid dang / grags pa mchog gi gzi brjid dang / blo gros bzang dang / zla ba'i dpal dang / zla ba dga' dang / cher dga' dang /🔽sgra gcan bzang dang / cher bzang la sogs pa dge bsnyen lnga brgya dang thabs gcig go /
translated: Rāhulabhadra, and Mahābhadra.

original: dge bsnyen ma lnga brgya tsam la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma lnga brgya tsam la 'di lta ste /
translated: and about five hundred male and female lay practitioners.

original: dge bsnyen ma 'od chen dang / 'od bzang dang / lus bzang dang / mngon dga' lus dang / bzang mo dang; bzang dpal dang / zla 'od dang / tog 'od dang / dpal 'od dang / mig bzang la sogs pa dge bsnyen ma lnga brgya dang yang thabs gcig go /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma 'od chen dang / 'od bzang dang / lus bzang dang / mngon dga' lus dang / bzang mo dang; bzang dpal dang / zla 'od dang / tog 'od dang / dpal 'od dang / mig bzang la sogs pa dge bsnyen ma lnga brgya dang yang thabs gcig go /
translated: He was also accompanied by about five hundred upāsikās, such as the upāsikās Mahāprabhā, Subhadrā, Subhadrākṣī, Subhadrāṅga, Subhadrī, Subhadraśrī, Candra­prabhā, Ketu­prabhā, Śrī­prabhā, and Subhadrākṣī.

original: de bzhin du lha dang / klu dang / gnod @10b sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas nas bcom ldan 'das chos ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha dang / klu dang / gnod @10b sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas nas bcom ldan 'das chos ston te /
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One was teaching the Dharma, surrounded and venerated by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

original: 'di lta ste; sdom pa gsum bstan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste; sdom pa gsum bstan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: He was teaching the Dharma door called “The Teaching of the Three Vows.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul /
translated: The domain of all the tathāgatas

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa rab tu brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad snang ba chos kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad yang dag par 'du bar snang ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa rab tu brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad snang ba chos kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad yang dag par 'du bar snang ba /
translated: the bodhisattva conduct called the illumination of the entire realm of phenomena, the appearance of the gathering of the entire realm of phenomena,

original: zhing gi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par sbyong ba'i rgyan /
analyzed: zhing gi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par sbyong ba'i rgyan /
translated: the ornament of the purification of the entire realm of fields,

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rnam par 'thor ba /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rnam par 'thor ba /
translated: the scattering of all opponents,

original: bdud kyi rtsod pa'i pha rol gyi dmag tshogs rab tu 'joms pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi rtsod pa'i pha rol gyi dmag tshogs rab tu 'joms pa /
translated: the complete destruction of the opposing armies of Māra,

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad sim par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad sim par byed pa /
translated: the satisfaction of the entire realm of beings,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi thibs po snang bar byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi thibs po snang bar byed pa /
translated: the illumination of the darkness in the minds of all beings,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du go bar byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du go bar byed pa /
translated: the understanding of the thoughts of all beings,

original: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po bzhin du 'khor lo bskor bar snang ba rab tu ston to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po bzhin du 'khor lo bskor bar snang ba rab tu ston to //
translated: and the teaching of the appearance of the turning of the wheel according to the faculties of all beings.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po stan las langs te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahākāśyapa rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu bgos nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas; bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu bgos nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas; bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He draped his upper robe over one shoulder and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽sems can gang dag sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa tshol ba de dag @11a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / sems can gang dag sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa tshol ba de dag @11a *//
translated: Bowing to the Blessed One with palms joined, he asked, “Blessed One,🔽what kind of Dharma should sentient beings who seek the qualities of buddhahood and who seek the powers and fearlessness of the Buddha

original: gis chos ji lta bu dag cig yang dag par blangs te gnas par bgyi /
analyzed: gis chos ji lta bu dag cig yang dag par blangs te gnas par bgyi /
translated: uphold?

original: de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni ji lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni ji lta bu zhig lags /
translated: What are the qualities that bring them to maturity?

original: de dag bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slar mi ldog cing thob par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni ci lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: de dag bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slar mi ldog cing thob par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni ci lta bu zhig lags /
translated: What are the qualities that prevent them from turning back from unsurpassed and perfect awakening and that lead them to attain it?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had thus requested, the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa,🔽“Excellent, Kāśyapa, excellent!

original: 'od srung khyod skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /🔽'di lta bu'i gnas dag 'dri bar sems pa ni /🔽'od srung khyod legs so //
analyzed: 'od srung khyod skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te / 'di lta bu'i gnas dag 'dri bar sems pa ni / 'od srung khyod legs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, you have asked about these topics in order to benefit many beings, to bring happiness to many beings, out of sympathy for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.🔽Kāśyapa, it is excellent, excellent, that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about these topics.

original: legs so // 'od srung /
analyzed: legs so // 'od srung /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is excellent, excellent, that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about these topics.

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas bshad do //
translated: Therefore, listen carefully and keep this in mind! I will explain it to you.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor des bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor des bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Venerable Mahākāśyapa and the entire assembly listened as the Blessed One had instructed. The Blessed One said to them,

original: 'od srung / sems can gang dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa tshol ba'i sems can de lta bu de dag gis /
analyzed: 'od srung / sems can gang dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa tshol ba'i sems can de lta bu de dag gis /
translated: “Kāśyapa, those beings who seek the wisdom of the buddhas, who seek the powers and fearlessness of the buddhas,

original: de dag gang la brten nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de dag gang la brten nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: I do not see any dharma on which the roots of virtue might be based.

original: 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed pa 'di dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @11b byang chub tshol zhing /
analyzed: 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed pa 'di dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @11b byang chub tshol zhing /
translated: “Kāśyapa, all these bodhisattvas seek unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las 'dus byas gzhan par sems shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las 'dus byas gzhan par sems shing /
translated: but they think that conditioned phenomena are different from the buddhadharmas,

original: 'dus ma byas las sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhan par sems la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas las sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhan par sems la /
translated: and they think that unconditioned phenomena are different from the buddhadharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems shing 'du shes la spyod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems shing 'du shes la spyod par 'gyur ram /
translated: Do they think about the buddhadharmas and practice with perceptions?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems pa'o //
translated: They think about the buddhadharmas.

original: snyam du shes na /
analyzed: snyam du shes na /
translated: If they know that,

original: shes pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las phyir log pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las phyir log pa yin te /
translated: that knowledge turns away from the buddhadharmas.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be called ‘those who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos su sems na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos su sems na /
translated: If they think about the buddhadharmas,

original: de bdag tu 'dzin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bdag tu 'dzin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the very grasping at self.

original: nyin gcig bzhin du sbyor bas de la brtson par byed na /
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du sbyor bas de la brtson par byed na /
translated: If one applies oneself to that day after day,

original: de ni de'i bdag tu 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag tu 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: that is one’s grasping at self.

original: 'bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bral ba ma yin no //
translated: One is not free from it.

original: gang ma bral ba de sems pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma bral ba de sems pa'o //
translated: That from which one is not free is the mind.

original: gang sems pa dang / gang gis sems pa dang / gang la sems pa de rnam par nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems pa dang / gang gis sems pa dang / gang la sems pa de rnam par nyams pa'o //
translated: That which is the mind, that by which the mind, and that in which the mind is present are all lost.

original: gang rnam par nyams pa de rnam par rgyug go /🔽gang rnam par rgyug pa de kun du rgyug go /
analyzed: gang rnam par nyams pa de rnam par rgyug go / gang rnam par rgyug pa de kun du rgyug go /
translated: That which is lost is running.🔽That which is running is rushing.

original: gang kun du rgyug pa de rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: gang kun du rgyug pa de rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: That which is rushing is following.

original: gang rjes su 'gro ba de rtog go /🔽gang rtog pa de rnam par rtog go /🔽gang rnam par rtog pa de rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: gang rjes su 'gro ba de rtog go / gang rtog pa de rnam par rtog go / gang rnam par rtog pa de rab tu rtog go /
translated: That which is following is conceptualizing.🔽That which is conceptualizing is discriminating.🔽That which is discriminating is thoroughly discriminating.

original: gang rab tu rtog pa de kun du rtog go /
analyzed: gang rab tu rtog pa de kun du rtog go /
translated: That which is thoroughly discriminating is thoroughly conceptualizing.

original: gang kun du rtog pa de ma zhi ba'o //🔽gang ma zhi ba de g-yon phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang kun du rtog pa de ma zhi ba'o // gang ma zhi ba de g-yon phyogs pa'o //
translated: That which is thoroughly conceptualizing is not peaceful.🔽That which is not peaceful is on the wrong track.

original: gang g-yon phyogs pa de 'khyam pa'o //
analyzed: gang g-yon phyogs pa de 'khyam pa'o //
translated: That which is on the wrong track is wandering.

original: gang 'khyam pa de phongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'khyam pa de phongs pa'o //
translated: That which is wandering is suffering.

original: cis phongs she na /
analyzed: cis phongs she na /
translated: What is it that is lacking?

original: bde bas phongs so //
analyzed: bde bas phongs so //
translated: It is lacking in happiness.

original: bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is happiness?

original: @12a *// gang la kun du rtog pa med pa de bde ba'o //
analyzed: @12a *// gang la kun du rtog pa med pa de bde ba'o //
translated: It is the absence of conceptualization.

original: gang phongs pa de skyon can no //🔽skyon can gang yin pa de nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang phongs pa de skyon can no // skyon can gang yin pa de nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: What is lacking is a fault.🔽What is a fault is a going.

original: gang nye bar 'gro ba de bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: gang nye bar 'gro ba de bag la nyal lo //
translated: What is a going is a latent tendency.

original: bag la nyal ba gang yin pa de mtshams sbyor ba'o //🔽gang mtshams sbyor ba de rnam par mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba gang yin pa de mtshams sbyor ba'o // gang mtshams sbyor ba de rnam par mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: What is a latent tendency is a connection.

original: gang rnam par mtshams sbyor ba de yongs su mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par mtshams sbyor ba de yongs su mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: What is a connection is a full connection.

original: gang yongs su mtshams sbyor ba de rnam par smra ba'o //🔽gang rnam par smra ba de smra ba lkugs pa'o //🔽gang smra ba lkugs pa de mya ngan byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang yongs su mtshams sbyor ba de rnam par smra ba'o // gang rnam par smra ba de smra ba lkugs pa'o // gang smra ba lkugs pa de mya ngan byed pa'o //
translated: What is a full connection is a verbal expression.🔽What is a verbal expression is a mute’s speech.🔽What is a mute’s speech is a lamentation.

original: gang mya ngan byed pa de tshig par byed pa'o; ;gang tshig par byed pa de nyams pa ste /
analyzed: gang mya ngan byed pa de tshig par byed pa'o; ;gang tshig par byed pa de nyams pa ste /
translated: What is a lamentation is a burning.🔽What is a burning is a loss.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos shes gang la gnas pa'i dra ba can no //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos shes gang la gnas pa'i dra ba can no //
translated: It is the web of the knowledge of pleasant and unpleasant phenomena.

original: 'di la chos gang yang gnas pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di la chos gang yang gnas pa med mod kyi /
translated: There is no phenomenon that abides here.

original: 'on kyang 'du shes kyi rgyun gyis 'du shes bcings shing /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'du shes kyi rgyun gyis 'du shes bcings shing /
translated: However, due to the continuity of perception, perception is bound.

original: 'du shes bcings pas 'du shes kyi rgyun te /
analyzed: 'du shes bcings pas 'du shes kyi rgyun te /
translated: Because perception is bound, there is a continuity of perception.

original: des na 'du shes kyis bcings pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'du shes kyis bcings pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘bound by perception.’

original: ma byung ba'i gnas ni 'dod chags kyi gnas /🔽khro ba'i gnas /🔽zhe sdang gi gnas /
analyzed: ma byung ba'i gnas ni 'dod chags kyi gnas / khro ba'i gnas / zhe sdang gi gnas /
translated: The basis of what has not arisen is the basis of desire,🔽the basis of anger,

original: gti mug gi gnas te /
analyzed: gti mug gi gnas te /
translated: the basis of ignorance,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa la rtog /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa la rtog /
translated: and the basis of incorrect conceptualization.🔽It is conceptualized,

original: rnam par rtog /
analyzed: rnam par rtog /
translated: conceived,

original: dpyod / rnam par dpyod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dpyod / rnam par dpyod pas de'i phyir /
translated: and analyzed by incorrect conceptualization.

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub myur du mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub myur du mi 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, one will not quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'od srung / de ltar na sred pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar na sred pa'i gnas te /
translated: Kāśyapa, that is the basis of craving.

original: ci'i phyir sred pa'i gnas zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sred pa'i gnas zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the basis of craving?

original: gang sred pa zhes bya ba'i chos de yang @12b gang yang med la /
analyzed: gang sred pa zhes bya ba'i chos de yang @12b gang yang med la /
translated: There is no phenomenon at all that is called ‘craving.’

original: 'di la gang gis sred pa'i chos kyang gang yang med cing /
analyzed: 'di la gang gis sred pa'i chos kyang gang yang med cing /
translated: There is no dharma at all that is craving.

original: de la gang la sred pa'i chos kyang gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gang la sred pa'i chos kyang gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no dharma at all that is craved.

original: 'on kyang sred pa zhes mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sred pa zhes mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen te /
translated: Nevertheless, one is attached to the notion of craving.

original: nam mkha' la sbag par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sbag par byed do //
translated: One is attached to space.

original: gang nam mkha' la sbag par byed pa des /
analyzed: gang nam mkha' la sbag par byed pa des /
translated: One who is attached to space

original: sbags pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbags pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: will find attachment.

original: bdag gis spags pa dang / sems can gyis sbags pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge bas spags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis spags pa dang / sems can gyis sbags pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge bas spags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to self, attachment to sentient beings, attachment to virtue and nonvirtue.🔽Kāśyapa, thus, those who imagine non-existent phenomena

original: 'od srung / de ltar na med pa'i chos rnams kyis rtog par byed pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar na med pa'i chos rnams kyis rtog par byed pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: have no basis.

original: gang dngos po med pa la dngos po'i 'du shes can de ni byang chub la dngos por byed do //
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa la dngos po'i 'du shes can de ni byang chub la dngos por byed do //
translated: Those who have the notion of an existent thing with regard to the nonexistent🔽make a basis out of awakening.

original: gang byang chub la dngos por byed pa de ni bdag gi 'du shes can no //
analyzed: gang byang chub la dngos por byed pa de ni bdag gi 'du shes can no //
translated: Those who make a basis out of awakening have the notion of a self.

original: bdag gi 'du shes can gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi 'du shes can gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Those who have the notion of a self are not called bodhisattvas.

original: ci'i phyir bdag gi 'du shes can zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gi 'du shes can zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the perception of self?

original: 'du shes mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du shes mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because perception is not perceived.

original: gang la 'du shes mi dmigs pa de la 'du shes can med de /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes mi dmigs pa de la 'du shes can med de /
translated: Where perception is not perceived, there is no one who perceives.

original: de'i phyir bdag gi 'du shes can zhes bya'o; ;'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi 'du shes can zhes bya'o; ;'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the perception of self.

original: bdag gi 'du zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzhi'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: bdag gi 'du zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzhi'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: Thus, the term ‘perception of self’ is a designation for an unreal basis.🔽Moreover, the perfection of beings is the perfection of awakening.

original: 'on kyang sems can yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de byang chub yongs su rdzogs pa'o; ;de la byang chub gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de byang chub yongs su rdzogs pa'o; ;de la byang chub gang zhe na /
translated: What is awakening?

original: gang sgyu mar gyur pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang sgyu mar gyur pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of what is illusory.

original: sgyu mar gyur pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgyu mar gyur pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is illusory?

original: sems can chen por 'du shes shing smra ba dang / srog chen por 'du shes shing smra @13a *//
analyzed: sems can chen por 'du shes shing smra ba dang / srog chen por 'du shes shing smra @13a *//
translated: It is the perception and expression of a great being, the perception and expression of a great life force.

original: ba'o; ;gang 'du shes dang / 'du shes la gnas par byed pa de 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa la gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba'o; ;gang 'du shes dang / 'du shes la gnas par byed pa de 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa la gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: One who abides in perception and the basis of perception abides in the absence of perception and the absence of a basis.

original: gang 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa la gnas pa de rgyags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa la gnas pa de rgyags par byed pa'o //
translated: Whoever is in a state of non-perception is intoxicated.

original: gang rgyags par byed pa de /
analyzed: gang rgyags par byed pa de /
translated: Whoever is intoxicated

original: sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal la kun du rgyug go /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal la kun du rgyug go /
translated: is in a state of suffering and runs around in suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal la kun du rgyug pa de smra ba la rgyug cing smras pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal la kun du rgyug pa de smra ba la rgyug cing smras pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: Whoever is in a state of suffering and runs around in suffering runs around in speech and is spoken to.

original: ci'i phyir smra ba la rgyug cing gnas pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir smra ba la rgyug cing gnas pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “running around in speech and being spoken to”?

original: shin tu yid la byed pa'i phyir ro; ;gang la yid la byed pa yod pa de la ngar 'dzin pa yod do //
analyzed: shin tu yid la byed pa'i phyir ro; ;gang la yid la byed pa yod pa de la ngar 'dzin pa yod do //
translated: Because of the extreme mental activity. Whoever has mental activity has the view of a self.

original: gang la ngar 'dzin pa yod pa de la byed pa yod do //
analyzed: gang la ngar 'dzin pa yod pa de la byed pa yod do //
translated: Whoever has the view of a self has action.

original: gang la byed pa yod pa de la shin tu yod do //
analyzed: gang la byed pa yod pa de la shin tu yod do //
translated: Whoever has action has extreme views.

original: gang la shin tu yod pa de kun du brjod pa dang / nye bar brjod pa dang / gnas par byed pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la shin tu yod pa de kun du brjod pa dang / nye bar brjod pa dang / gnas par byed pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs te /
translated: Whoever has extreme views expresses and describes them and is fixed on them.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni yid la byed pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni yid la byed pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena arise from mental activity.

original: 'od srung; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung; 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / steng gi bar snang las sprin gyi phung po byung ba de dag ni shar phyogs nas ma 'ongs /
analyzed: dper na / steng gi bar snang las sprin gyi phung po byung ba de dag ni shar phyogs nas ma 'ongs /
translated: Clouds form in the sky above, but they do not come from the east,

original: lho phyogs nas ma yin /
analyzed: lho phyogs nas ma yin /
translated: nor do they come from the south,

original: nub phyogs nas ma yin /
analyzed: nub phyogs nas ma yin /
translated: nor from the west,🔽nor from the north,

original: byang phyogs nas ma yin; steng nas ma yin /
analyzed: byang phyogs nas ma yin; steng nas ma yin /
translated: nor from above,

original: 'og nas ma yin /🔽phyogs nas ma yin /
analyzed: 'og nas ma yin / phyogs nas ma yin /
translated: nor from below,

original: phyogs mtshams nas kyang ma 'ongs te /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams nas kyang ma 'ongs te /
translated: nor from any direction or in-between direction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag pa gsung bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag pa gsung bas /
translated: The Tathāgata, the one who speaks the truth,

original: de phyogs bcu nas ma @13b 'ongs par mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de phyogs bcu nas ma @13b 'ongs par mkhyen nas /
translated: knows that they do not come from the ten directions,

original: don gyi tshul dang / rigs pa'i tshul dang / yang dag pa'i tshul gyis sprin gyi phung po ni phung po med pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs te /
analyzed: don gyi tshul dang / rigs pa'i tshul dang / yang dag pa'i tshul gyis sprin gyi phung po ni phung po med pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs te /
translated: and he correctly teaches the truth, in accordance with the way things are, that a mass of clouds is not a mass.

original: des na phung po med pa ni sprin gyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na phung po med pa ni sprin gyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a mass that is not a mass is called a mass of clouds.

original: ci'i phyir sprin gyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sprin gyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called a mass of clouds?

original: yangs pa'i gnas kyis so //
analyzed: yangs pa'i gnas kyis so //
translated: Because of the vastness of the place.

original: yangs pa'i gnas ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: yangs pa'i gnas ji lta bus she na /
translated: And what is the vastness of the place?

original: mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi sbyor bas lding ba'i mtshan ma'o zhes rgyud 'khrul gyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi sbyor bas lding ba'i mtshan ma'o zhes rgyud 'khrul gyi /
translated: It is the sign of the flying of the various signs of the clouds.

original: de la ni lding bar rnam par shes par byed pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la ni lding bar rnam par shes par byed pa gang yang med do //
translated: But there is nothing there that flies.

original: sprin gyi phung po ni lding ba'i mtshan ma las byung ba la ltos /
analyzed: sprin gyi phung po ni lding ba'i mtshan ma las byung ba la ltos /
translated: Look at the mass of clouds that arises from the sign of flying.

original: de la lding ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de la lding ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The sign of flying is signless.

original: gang lding bar shin tu 'du shes pa de ni sprin gyi phung po ma yin no //
analyzed: gang lding bar shin tu 'du shes pa de ni sprin gyi phung po ma yin no //
translated: What is the perception of flying is not the mass of clouds.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi la la zhig gis mi gzhan zhig la 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: dper na / mi la la zhig gis mi gzhan zhig la 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: Suppose someone says to another person:

original: grib ma der dong la 'khod par bya'o //
analyzed: grib ma der dong la 'khod par bya'o //
translated: “Go to that shadow and sit down.”

original: de nas mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi des 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: de nas mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi des 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: Then the wise person says:

original: kho bo ni spro ba med de /
analyzed: kho bo ni spro ba med de /
translated: “I am not interested.

original: 'di na 'dug go ;des 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: 'di na 'dug go ;des 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: I will stay here.” The other person says:🔽“That shadow is not a shadow.

original: kho bo ni khyod la mi zer gyi /
analyzed: kho bo ni khyod la mi zer gyi /
translated: I am not talking about you.

original: grib ma 'di la zer ro //🔽des 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: grib ma 'di la zer ro // des 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: I am talking about this shadow.”

original: kye mi khyod kyis gang gri ba ma de la smras pa de ni grib ma med pa smras so zhes zer na /
analyzed: kye mi khyod kyis gang gri ba ma de la smras pa de ni grib ma med pa smras so zhes zer na /
translated: The man said, “Hey, you are talking about something that has no shadow.”

original: 'od srung / mi des tha snyad kyi gnas ji snyed pa de gang gis rjes su rtogs pa la ltos /
analyzed: 'od srung / mi des tha snyad kyi gnas ji snyed pa de gang gis rjes su rtogs pa la ltos /
translated: Kāśyapa, look how that man understood the basis of conventional reality.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnams kyi tshul mkhyen nas 'khor @14a *//
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnams kyi tshul mkhyen nas 'khor @14a *//
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, the Tathāgata, knowing the way of phenomena,

original: la yang dag par seng ge'i sgra sgrog go /
analyzed: la yang dag par seng ge'i sgra sgrog go /
translated: roars his lion’s roar in the assembly.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa ni bzhed na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa ni bzhed na /
translated: Kāśyapa, if the Tathāgata wishes,

original: mthun pa'i chos rnams la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can du gnas te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos rnams la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can du gnas te /
translated: he can remain in the perception of disharmony with regard to harmonious phenomena.

original: sems can rnams kyi bdag gi 'du shes gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i don dam pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bdag gi 'du shes gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i don dam pa'o //
translated: The perception of self that sentient beings have is the ultimate for the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen la /
translated: Why is that?🔽The Tathāgata knows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Tathāgata knows.

original: sems can gyi 'du shes gang yin pa de ni 'du shes med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes gang yin pa de ni 'du shes med pa'o //
translated: The perception of sentient beings is non-perception.

original: de la byis pa'i rang bzhin can la la zhig grib ma de'i ldem po ngag dam pa de ma shes pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rgol te /🔽de la nges 'di skad du 'jig rten ni nga la rgol gyi /
analyzed: de la byis pa'i rang bzhin can la la zhig grib ma de'i ldem po ngag dam pa de ma shes pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rgol te / de la nges 'di skad du 'jig rten ni nga la rgol gyi /
translated: Some childish people do not understand the subtlety of that perception. They argue with the Tathāgata.

original: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this regard, the Tathāgata says, “The world argues with me, but I do not argue with the world.”

original: de la 'jig rten gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gang zhe na /
translated: What is the world?

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The world is

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: the world of sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir sems can gyi 'jig rten la bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can gyi 'jig rten la bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the world of sentient beings?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar mkhyen pa 'jig rten yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar mkhyen pa 'jig rten yang de bzhin te /
translated: The world is just as the Tathāgata knows it to be.

original: de'i phyir sems can la 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can la 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings are called the world.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ji ltar shes pa de ni 'jig pa /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ji ltar shes pa de ni 'jig pa /
translated: The childish, ordinary beings know it as something that perishes,

original: rab tu 'jig pa'o //🔽nyams par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa'o // nyams par 'gyur ba /
translated: completely perishes,🔽decays,

original: rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and deteriorates.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rnam par 'jig pa de ni de dag gi tha snyad 'di go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa de ni de dag gi tha snyad 'di go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This destruction is what makes their conventions understood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang dag 'jig rten 'di ni gnas pa de dag rnam par 'jig pa chen por gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten 'di ni gnas pa de dag rnam par 'jig pa chen por gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those who abide in this world are in a state of great destruction.

original: gang dag 'jig @14b rten 'di na gnas pa de dag ni brkam pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig @14b rten 'di na gnas pa de dag ni brkam pa'o //
translated: Those who abide in this world are greedy.

original: gang dag brkam pa de dag khro ba'o //🔽gang dag khro ba de dag rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag brkam pa de dag khro ba'o // gang dag khro ba de dag rmongs pa'o //
translated: Those who are greedy are angry.🔽Those who are angry are deluded.

original: gang dag rmongs pa de dag ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag rmongs pa de dag ma dag pa'o //
translated: Those who are deluded are impure.

original: gang dag ma dag pa de dag 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag ma dag pa de dag 'gal ba'o //
translated: Those who are impure are in conflict.

original: su dang 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: su dang 'gal zhe na /
translated: With whom are they in conflict?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams dang 'gal lo //
translated: They are in conflict with the Tathāgata and the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: gang dag 'gal ba de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'gal ba de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Those who are in conflict are not accepted.

original: gang dag rjes su 'dzin pa de dag so sor 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag rjes su 'dzin pa de dag so sor 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Those who are not accepted are not included.

original: gang dag so sor 'dzin pa de dag srid pa tshol ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag so sor 'dzin pa de dag srid pa tshol ba'o //
translated: Those who are not included seek existence.

original: gang dag srid pa tshol ba de dag tshol ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag srid pa tshol ba de dag tshol ba'o //
translated: Those who seek existence are seekers.

original: gang dag tshol ba de dag yongs su tshol ba'o;/
analyzed: gang dag tshol ba de dag yongs su tshol ba'o;/
translated: Those who seek are seeking.

original: gang dag yongs su tshol ba de dag 'dod pa chung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag yongs su tshol ba de dag 'dod pa chung ba ma yin no //
translated: Those who are seeking are not of little desire.

original: gang dag 'dod pa chung ba ma yin pa de dag bya ba mang ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa chung ba ma yin pa de dag bya ba mang ba'o //
translated: Those who are not of little desire are of much activity.

original: gang dag bya ba mang ba de dag 'dod pa che ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag bya ba mang ba de dag 'dod pa che ba'o //
translated: Those who are of much activity are of great desire.

original: gang dag 'dod pa che ba de dag 'dod pa'i khams bag la nyal bar byed /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa che ba de dag 'dod pa'i khams bag la nyal bar byed /
translated: Those who are of great desire are dormant in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams bag la nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams bag la nyal bar byed do //
translated: dormant in the form realm, and dormant in the formless realm.

original: gang dag bag la zhen par byed pa de dag bag la nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: gang dag bag la zhen par byed pa de dag bag la nyal bar byed do //
translated: Those who are dormant are dormant.

original: gang dag bag la nyal bar byed pa de dag rgyun dang rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag bag la nyal bar byed pa de dag rgyun dang rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Those who are dormant are flowing along with the stream.

original: gang dag rgyun dang rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba de dag 'chi bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag rgyun dang rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba de dag 'chi bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Those who are flowing along with the stream are going to death.

original: gang dag 'chi bar 'gro ba de dag mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'chi bar 'gro ba de dag mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: Those who are going to death are not going to nirvāṇa.

original: gang dag mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba de dag 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba'o //🔽gang dag 'gro ba ma yin par @15a *//
analyzed: gang dag mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba de dag 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba'o // gang dag 'gro ba ma yin par @15a *//
translated: Those who do not go to nirvāṇa go to non-going.

original: 'gro ba de dag thams cad sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba de dag thams cad sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Those who go to non-going go to all destinies.

original: 'od srung / de ltar na bkra mi shis pa'i sbyor bas sbyor gyis /
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar na bkra mi shis pa'i sbyor bas sbyor gyis /
translated: Kāśyapa, thus it is that one is bound by the practice of inauspiciousness.

original: khro ba dang 'khrug pas mi sbyor ba ma yin /
analyzed: khro ba dang 'khrug pas mi sbyor ba ma yin /
translated: One is not bound by anger and agitation.

original: rnam par 'jig pas ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pas ma yin no //
translated: One is not bound by destruction.

original: gang dag rnam par 'jig pas ma yin pa de dag bdag gi 'du shes la rnam par rtog par mi byed do //🔽gang dag bdag gi 'du shes la rnam par rtog par mi byed pa de dag nga zhe'am /
analyzed: gang dag rnam par 'jig pas ma yin pa de dag bdag gi 'du shes la rnam par rtog par mi byed do // gang dag bdag gi 'du shes la rnam par rtog par mi byed pa de dag nga zhe'am /
translated: Those who are not bound by destruction do not conceptualize the notion of self.

original: nga'i zhes gong bur byed do //
analyzed: nga'i zhes gong bur byed do //
translated: Those who do not conceptualize the notion of self do not think “I” or “mine.”🔽They do not form a heap.

original: zag par byed do //🔽ci'i phyir nga zhe'am /
analyzed: zag par byed do // ci'i phyir nga zhe'am /
translated: They do not form a defilement.

original: nga'i zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: nga'i zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why do they not think “I” or “mine”?🔽Because of the non-existence of the self and what belongs to the self.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pas 'du shes rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas nas las mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pas 'du shes rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas nas las mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: Due to the non-apprehension of the self and what belongs to the self, they do not form mental constructs.

original: gang dag 'du shes rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis gnas nas las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag bdag la nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag 'du shes rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis gnas nas las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag bdag la nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who are attached to various perceptions create karma.

original: ci'i phyir nga'i zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nga'i zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “mine”?

original: brnab sems dang / nga'i dang / 'dod pa rnams kyis 'du 'dzi la mngon par gtod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po 'jig par byed pa dang / gzhan la gnod sems kyi sems su byed pa dang / khro bas zil gyis non pa dang /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / nga'i dang / 'dod pa rnams kyis 'du 'dzi la mngon par gtod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po 'jig par byed pa dang / gzhan la gnod sems kyi sems su byed pa dang / khro bas zil gyis non pa dang /
translated: Because of covetousness, the idea of “mine,” and attachment to desires, one is attached to distractions, one destroys the aggregate of morality, one has a malicious mind toward others, one is overcome by anger,

original: de yang bdag la rnam par nga rgyal byed pa dang / 'bru rjen pa bdag gir byed pa dang / len pa dang / sdud pa dang / nye bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bdag la rnam par nga rgyal byed pa dang / 'bru rjen pa bdag gir byed pa dang / len pa dang / sdud pa dang / nye bar byed pa ste /
translated: and one has pride in oneself, one appropriates raw grain, one takes, one accumulates, and one hoards.

original: de'i phyir nga'i zhes bya'o //🔽gang dag nga yir byed pa de dag 'khyam pa'o //🔽gang dag 'khyam pa de dag rmongs pa'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir nga'i zhes bya'o // gang dag nga yir byed pa de dag 'khyam pa'o // gang dag 'khyam pa de dag rmongs pa'o /
translated: Therefore, it is called “mine.”🔽Those who appropriate are wandering.🔽Those who wander are confused.

original: @15b gang dag rmongs pa de dag sdang ba'o //
analyzed: @15b gang dag rmongs pa de dag sdang ba'o //
translated: Those who are confused are hateful.

original: gang dag sdang ba de dag gshe ba'o //🔽gang dag gshe ba de dag za ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag sdang ba de dag gshe ba'o // gang dag gshe ba de dag za ba'o //
translated: Those who are angry are reviled.🔽Those who are reviled are eaten.

original: gang dag za ba de dag tshig pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag za ba de dag tshig pa'o //
translated: Those who are eaten are burned.

original: gang dag tshig pa de dag yongs su chags pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag tshig pa de dag yongs su chags pa ste /
translated: Those who are burned are completely attached.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis bud med kyi 'du shes dang / skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / srog gi 'du shes kyis bdag gir byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis bud med kyi 'du shes dang / skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / srog gi 'du shes kyis bdag gir byed de /
translated: Because of attachment to desire, they are attached to the idea of a woman, the idea of a man, and the idea of a life force.

original: de'i phyir nga'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga'i zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘mine.’

original: yang don du na /
analyzed: yang don du na /
translated: Moreover, in reality,

original: de ni bdag la mi snyan pa brjod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag la mi snyan pa brjod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called ‘speaking unpleasantly to oneself.’

original: bdag gi phyir byis pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir byis pa'o //
translated: It is childish because of oneself.

original: byis pa'i tshul bag la nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: byis pa'i tshul bag la nyal bar byed do //
translated: It is the childish way to lie in wait.

original: des na nga'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na nga'i zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘mine.’

original: 'od srung / de ltar na gang chos 'di dag ma thos par byang chub tu khas 'che ba'am /
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar na gang chos 'di dag ma thos par byang chub tu khas 'che ba'am /
translated: Kāśyapa, in that way, those who declare enlightenment without having heard these teachings

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod par khas 'che ba de spyod pa khas 'che ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod par khas 'che ba de spyod pa khas 'che ba'o //
translated: or declare the bodhisattva way are declaring a way of life.

original: 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yin pa de la spyod pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yin pa de la spyod pa gang yang med de /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the bodhisattva conduct there is no conduct at all.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //🔽'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' gang gi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / tshang bar 'gyur ba dang / tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / dag par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o // 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' gang gi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / tshang bar 'gyur ba dang / tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / dag par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Therefore it is called the bodhisattva conduct.

original: rnam par gnon par 'gyur ba'i skabs yod do //
analyzed: rnam par gnon par 'gyur ba'i skabs yod do //
translated: Kāśyapa, there is an occasion for the bodhisattva to complete, to perfect, to gather, to purify, to be purified, to be completely purified, and to overcome the conduct.

original: de dag chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de dag chos kyang ston te /
translated: They teach the Dharma.

original: chos de dag nam mkha' ltar byas kyi /
analyzed: chos de dag nam mkha' ltar byas kyi /
translated: Those dharmas are made like space.

original: chos de dag phung por ma byas so //
analyzed: chos de dag phung por ma byas so //
translated: Those dharmas are not made into aggregates.

original: de dag rigs pa rnams la chos chen po ston te /
analyzed: de dag rigs pa rnams la chos chen po ston te /
translated: They teach the great Dharma to those who are suitable,

original: mi rigs pa rnams la ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rigs pa rnams la ma yin no //
translated: but not to those who are not suitable.

original: yon @16a *// tan dang ldan pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: yon @16a *// tan dang ldan pa rnams la ste /
translated: They teach to those who have qualities,

original: nyes par gnas pa rnams la ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par gnas pa rnams la ma yin no //
translated: but not to those who are established in faults.

original: tshul dang ldan pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: tshul dang ldan pa rnams la ste /
translated: They teach to those who are disciplined,🔽but not to those who are undisciplined.

original: tshul ngan pa rnams la ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul ngan pa rnams la ma yin no //
translated: not to the wicked.

original: khyed kyis chos de dag gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: khyed kyis chos de dag gzung bar bya ste /
translated: You should take up these teachings.

original: ji ltar chos la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ba da ltar gzung zhig /
analyzed: ji ltar chos la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ba da ltar gzung zhig /
translated: Take them up without clinging to them as phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Thus-Gone One

original: mchog gsung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mchog gsung ba'i phyir te /
translated: teaches the supreme Dharma.

original: sems can gzung bar 'os pa rnams kyi don gyi phyir dris pa de la ngas chos kyi mchog gis lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzung bar 'os pa rnams kyi don gyi phyir dris pa de la ngas chos kyi mchog gis lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: I will answer your question with the supreme Dharma for the sake of those beings who are worthy of being taken up.

original: de la chos kyi mchog gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi mchog gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supreme Dharma?

original: gang la chos kyi 'du shes med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la chos kyi 'du shes med pa'o //
translated: It is that which is free from the perception of phenomena.

original: 'od srung / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nyid du tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nyid du tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Kāśyapa, in this regard, bodhisattvas first become disciplined.

original: gang gi sems la rjes su 'gyod pa yod pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi sems la rjes su 'gyod pa yod pa ni /
translated: Those whose minds are free from regret

original: mtshams med pa byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: do not commit the heinous actions.

original: dge slong ma sun par byed par mi 'gyur /🔽khyim gyi nang du 'dre bar mi 'gyur /🔽srog gcod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong ma sun par byed par mi 'gyur / khyim gyi nang du 'dre bar mi 'gyur / srog gcod par mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not slander the bhikṣuṇīs.🔽They do not associate with householders.🔽They do not kill.

original: ma byin par len par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ma byin par len par mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not steal.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem par mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not engage in sexual misconduct.

original: brdzun smra bar mi 'gyur /🔽phra ma smra bar mi 'gyur /🔽ngag rtsub po smra bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: brdzun smra bar mi 'gyur / phra ma smra bar mi 'gyur / ngag rtsub po smra bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not lie.🔽They will not engage in divisive speech.🔽They will not speak harshly.

original: tshig kyal ba smra bar mi 'gyur /🔽brnab sems can du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: tshig kyal ba smra bar mi 'gyur / brnab sems can du mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not speak meaninglessly.🔽They will not be covetous.

original: gnod sems can du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gnod sems can du mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not have a malicious mind.

original: log par lta bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: log par lta bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not have wrong views.

original: bdag la gnod par bya bar mi sems /
analyzed: bdag la gnod par bya bar mi sems /
translated: They will not think of harming themselves.

original: gzhan la gnod par bya bar mi sems /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par bya bar mi sems /
translated: They will not think of harming others.

original: 'du ba 'dod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du ba 'dod par mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not desire to be in a crowd.

original: longs @16b spyod la 'dod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: longs @16b spyod la 'dod par mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not desire wealth.

original: brgyal bar bya ba'i rtsed mo rnams gzhan dag la brjod par mi byed /
analyzed: brgyal bar bya ba'i rtsed mo rnams gzhan dag la brjod par mi byed /
translated: They will not speak of games that cause fainting to others.

original: bdag kyang mi byed /
analyzed: bdag kyang mi byed /
translated: They will not do them themselves.

original: ma ning dang bsten par mi byed /
analyzed: ma ning dang bsten par mi byed /
translated: They will not associate with eunuchs.🔽They will not be in the company of prostitutes.

original: smad 'tshong ma spyod yul bar mi 'gyur; yugs mo spyod yul bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: smad 'tshong ma spyod yul bar mi 'gyur; yugs mo spyod yul bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not be in the company of widows.

original: na chung chen mo spyod yul bar mi 'gyur /🔽bya pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: na chung chen mo spyod yul bar mi 'gyur / bya pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not be in the company of young girls.🔽They will not associate with bird catchers.

original: nya pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nya pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not associate with fishermen.

original: de dag ri dvags kyi rngon pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /🔽gsod pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag ri dvags kyi rngon pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur / gsod pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not associate with hunters or with butchers.

original: gdol pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gdol pa dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not associate with executioners or with outcastes.

original: gzhan gyi chung ma dang bsten par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma dang bsten par mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not associate with the wives of others.

original: mir ro ba'i lag nas 'dzin pa'am rtsod par mi byed de /
analyzed: mir ro ba'i lag nas 'dzin pa'am rtsod par mi byed de /
translated: They do not take the hand of a woman who is not free, nor do they quarrel.🔽They avoid them as they would a dog or an outcaste.

original: de dag khyi dang gdol pa ltar yongs su spong bas yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: de dag khyi dang gdol pa ltar yongs su spong bas yongs su spong ngo //
translated: They avoid them completely.

original: gang dag yongs su spangs pa de la 'khrul pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam gyi sems kyang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: gang dag yongs su spangs pa de la 'khrul pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam gyi sems kyang mi bskyed do //
translated: They do not even have a single thought of confusion about what they have avoided.

original: de ltar na byams pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa'i sems kyis gnas nyi shu yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na byams pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa'i sems kyis gnas nyi shu yongs su spong ngo //
translated: In this way, with a mind that is oriented toward the aspect of love, they avoid twenty kinds of situations.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: bud med yongs su spong zhing su dang yang sprod par mi byed la su dang yang 'tham par mi byed cing /
analyzed: bud med yongs su spong zhing su dang yang sprod par mi byed la su dang yang 'tham par mi byed cing /
translated: They avoid women, they do not associate with anyone, they do not embrace anyone,

original: smra ba la phyir smra bar mi byed pa dang / pha ma la mi gus par mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mi gus par mi 'gyur ba dang / nyi shur ma tshang bar bud med kyi 'khor lo chos mi 'chad cing /
analyzed: smra ba la phyir smra bar mi byed pa dang / pha ma la mi gus par mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mi gus par mi 'gyur ba dang / nyi shur ma tshang bar bud med kyi 'khor lo chos mi 'chad cing /
translated: not to speak back to those who speak to him; not to be disrespectful to his parents; not to be disrespectful to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha; not to teach the Dharma to a circle of women who are less than twenty years old;

original: gal te skyes pa'i gnas na gnas par gyur pa na de'i tshe chos ston pa dang / dge slong ma'i phun sum tshogs par thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gro bar mi bya ba dang / @17a *//
analyzed: gal te skyes pa'i gnas na gnas par gyur pa na de'i tshe chos ston pa dang / dge slong ma'i phun sum tshogs par thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gro bar mi bya ba dang / @17a *//
translated: and if he is in a place where there are men, then at that time not to teach the Dharma; and not to go to the perfection of the bhikṣuṇīs at all;

original: dge slong mas dris pa'i lan gdab par mi bya ba dang / bud med kyis yi ge bri bar mi bya ba dang / gsol ba ma btab par sbyin par mi bya ba dang / gnyen 'dab kyis mgron du bos pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du bdag gir mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong mas dris pa'i lan gdab par mi bya ba dang / bud med kyis yi ge bri bar mi bya ba dang / gsol ba ma btab par sbyin par mi bya ba dang / gnyen 'dab kyis mgron du bos pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du bdag gir mi bya ba dang /
translated: not to answer questions asked by bhikṣuṇīs; not to write letters; not to give without being asked; and not to accept invitations from relatives at all;

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'dod chags dang bcas pas rjes su chags pa'i sems kyis bud med kyi mdun du yud tsam yang gnas par mi bya ba dang / de gcig pu dgon par song ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'dod chags dang bcas pas rjes su chags pa'i sems kyis bud med kyi mdun du yud tsam yang gnas par mi bya ba dang / de gcig pu dgon par song ste /
translated: He should not stay even for a moment in the presence of a woman with a mind of lustful attachment.🔽He should not go to a solitary place and talk about his own country.

original: rang gi yul bsten pa rnam pa thams cad du brjod par mi bya ba dang / dge slong mas bsgugs pa la rnam pa thams cad du slar bsgugs par mi bya /
analyzed: rang gi yul bsten pa rnam pa thams cad du brjod par mi bya ba dang / dge slong mas bsgugs pa la rnam pa thams cad du slar bsgugs par mi bya /
translated: He should not wait for a nun in any way.

original: dge slong mas byin pa'i chos gos rnam pa thams cad du bgo bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong mas byin pa'i chos gos rnam pa thams cad du bgo bar mi bya ste /
translated: He should not wear a Dharma robe given by a nun.

original: gzhan du na 'khor bzhi po rnams kyi nang na 'dug cing chos 'chad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'khor bzhi po rnams kyi nang na 'dug cing chos 'chad pa'i tshe /
translated: However, when he is teaching Dharma to the four assemblies,

original: chos la dgab par bya ba ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: chos la dgab par bya ba ni ma gtogs te /
translated: he should be an exception in order to cover himself with the Dharma.

original: de la yang des sa dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis yid la byad par bsgyur nas spyad par bya ba dang / yang de'i ngor blta bar mi bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du dge slong mas byas pa'i chos gos nyan pa'i gnas su yang bgo bar mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la yang des sa dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis yid la byad par bsgyur nas spyad par bya ba dang / yang de'i ngor blta bar mi bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du dge slong mas byas pa'i chos gos nyan pa'i gnas su yang bgo bar mi bya ba dang /
translated: In this regard, she should not be served by a monk who has a mind equal to the earth, nor should she be looked at, nor should she be dressed in the robes made by a nun in any way,

original: nam yang dge slong mas mgron du bos pa la rnam pa thams cad du khas blang bar mi bya na /
analyzed: nam yang dge slong mas mgron du bos pa la rnam pa thams cad du khas blang bar mi bya na /
translated: nor should she ever accept an invitation by a nun in any way.🔽If she should not accept an invitation by a nun who is happy or healthy, what need is there to mention one who is by nature a widow?

original: bde ba'am / nad med pa'i rang bzhin can lta ci smos pa dang / yugs sa mos mgron du bos pa na dge 'dun med par rnam pa thams cad du khas blang bar mi @17b bya ba dang / dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du rnam pa thams cad du 'jug par mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: bde ba'am / nad med pa'i rang bzhin can lta ci smos pa dang / yugs sa mos mgron du bos pa na dge 'dun med par rnam pa thams cad du khas blang bar mi @17b bya ba dang / dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du rnam pa thams cad du 'jug par mi bya ba dang /
translated: If she should not accept an invitation by a widow in any way, if she should not enter a nunnery in any way,

original: rnam pa thams cad du dge slong ma'i dbang du mi bya /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dge slong ma'i dbang du mi bya /
translated: and if she should not be under the control of a nun in any way,

original: gal te dge slong mas bos na yang lag pa bsnol la mgo smad de sa phyogs de nas 'gro bar bya ba dang / chos ston cing 'dug pa'i gan du dge slong ma rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'ong na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong mas bos na yang lag pa bsnol la mgo smad de sa phyogs de nas 'gro bar bya ba dang / chos ston cing 'dug pa'i gan du dge slong ma rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'ong na /
translated: If a nun comes to bow down at the feet of a monk who is teaching the Dharma,

original: snyim pas gdong bkab ste 'dug par bya zhing /
analyzed: snyim pas gdong bkab ste 'dug par bya zhing /
translated: she should cover her face with her palms.

original: des rkang pa bskyod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: des rkang pa bskyod par mi bya ste /
translated: He should not move his feet.

original: skyes bu dam pas lus dpa' bar mi bya'i /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pas lus dpa' bar mi bya'i /
translated: A holy man does not show off his body.🔽He should show off his mind by being one-pointed.

original: rtse gcig tu yid la bya bas sems dpa' bar bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad la kun du 'dod chags kyi sems rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par mi bya ba dang / khong khro ba'i sems rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtse gcig tu yid la bya bas sems dpa' bar bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad la kun du 'dod chags kyi sems rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par mi bya ba dang / khong khro ba'i sems rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par mi bya ba ste /
translated: He should not arouse thoughts of desire for any object, nor should he arouse thoughts of anger for any object.🔽Thus, for the sake of omniscience, he should stabilize his commitments,

original: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir dam bcas pa brtan par bya ba dang / chos 'di dag thos nas nan tan gyis bsgrub par mngon par brtson par bya ba dang / 'od srung /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir dam bcas pa brtan par bya ba dang / chos 'di dag thos nas nan tan gyis bsgrub par mngon par brtson par bya ba dang / 'od srung /
translated: and having heard these teachings, he should strive to practice them.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa gang zhig chos de dag thos ma thag tu nan tan gyis mi sgrub na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa gang zhig chos de dag thos ma thag tu nan tan gyis mi sgrub na /
translated: “Son of a good family or daughter of a good family who has set out in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, if, after hearing those dharmas, they do not practice them right away,

original: des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: they will not be able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'od srung / nan tan gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob kyi /
analyzed: 'od srung / nan tan gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob kyi /
translated: Kāśyapa, unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is attained through practice,

original: nan tan med pas ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'od srung / gal te nan tan med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @18a *//
analyzed: nan tan med pas ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'od srung / gal te nan tan med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @18a *//
translated: not without practice.

original: pa'i byang chub thob tu zin na ni /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub thob tu zin na ni /
translated: Kāśyapa, if unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening were attained without practice,🔽even rabbits and cats would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete buddhahood.

original: ri bong dang / byi la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
