analyzed: de lta bas na de dag las bdag gir bya ba nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ma dkrug so zhes gnong mi bskur bas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because they do not see that they themselves are subject to the same thing, they will not be ashamed and will reject the Awakening of the Buddhas.

original: 'od srung / gzhan yang de'i dus na dge 'dun gyi rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'od srung / gzhan yang de'i dus na dge 'dun gyi rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Kāśyapa, at that time they will not follow the Saṅgha.

original: 'di yang de'i dus na mtshan ma'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang de'i dus na mtshan ma'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This will be a sign of the end of the true Dharma.

original: 'od srung / gzhan yang de'i dus na phal cher byas pa mi gzo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'od srung / gzhan yang de'i dus na phal cher byas pa mi gzo bar 'gyur /
translated: “Kāśyapa, at that time most will be ungrateful.

original: bslus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslus par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will deceive.

original: ji srid cig tu bslus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid cig tu bslus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: For how long will they deceive?

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas de dag gi bsnyad pa brjod par 'gyur ba de srid du bslus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas de dag gi bsnyad pa brjod par 'gyur ba de srid du bslus par 'gyur ro //
translated: For as long as the Tathāgata’s teachings are being recited, they will deceive.

original: phyir zhing tshig gis yongs su bslu bas zas mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir zhing tshig gis yongs su bslu bas zas mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will deceive by means of words and will not obtain food.

original: 'od srung / gzhan yang de'i dus na phal cher byas pa mi gzo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'od srung / gzhan yang de'i dus na phal cher byas pa mi gzo bar 'gyur /
translated: “Kāśyapa, at that time most will be ungrateful.

original: so sor thar pa la bsngags par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: so sor thar pa la bsngags par mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not praise the prātimokṣa.

original: ngag gi las ma bsrungs par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag ngag gi las ma bsrungs pas spyod lam @21a *//
analyzed: ngag gi las ma bsrungs par 'gyur ro // de dag ngag gi las ma bsrungs pas spyod lam @21a *//
translated: They will not guard their speech.

original: ma bsrungs la /
analyzed: ma bsrungs la /
translated: Because they do not guard their speech, they will not guard their conduct.🔽They will not guard their conduct.

original: de dag rung ba ma yin pa'i gnas la gnas shing /
analyzed: de dag rung ba ma yin pa'i gnas la gnas shing /
translated: They will dwell in inappropriate places.

original: rung ba ma yin pa la gnas pa rnams la chos ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa la gnas pa rnams la chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: They will teach the Dharma to those who are not suitable vessels.

original: de ltar chos 'di la mthar gyis cher 'bad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos 'di la mthar gyis cher 'bad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they will not make great efforts in this Dharma.

original: de ltar mthar gyis bud med dang lhan cig gnas pa shin tu mang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mthar gyis bud med dang lhan cig gnas pa shin tu mang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, they will gradually come to spend a great deal of time with women.

original: de dag skyes pa rnams spangs nas gtsug lag khang du 'dong zhing gtsug lag khang du zhugs nas lhan cig 'khod cing sangs rgyas kyi bka' brjod de /
analyzed: de dag skyes pa rnams spangs nas gtsug lag khang du 'dong zhing gtsug lag khang du zhugs nas lhan cig 'khod cing sangs rgyas kyi bka' brjod de /
translated: Abandoning men, they will go to the monasteries. Having entered the monasteries, they will sit together and recite the Buddha’s words.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ltar bcos pa'i gtam rab tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ltar bcos pa'i gtam rab tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will give teachings that are a facsimile of nirvāṇa.

original: 'od srung / chos ni lnga brgya kun nas nyon mongs pa yang lnga brgyar zad na /
analyzed: 'od srung / chos ni lnga brgya kun nas nyon mongs pa yang lnga brgyar zad na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, I have thought about the Dharma, which is five hundred in number, and the afflictions, which are five hundred in number.

original: de'i tshe mngon par mi brtson pa'i skyes bu gang zag gi chos ma yin pa'i sgo ni mang bar ngas dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon par mi brtson pa'i skyes bu gang zag gi chos ma yin pa'i sgo ni mang bar ngas dgongs te /
translated: At that time, I thought about the many non-dharmas of people who do not make effort.

original: de'i dus na de dag mi nyung bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i dus na de dag mi nyung bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: At that time, there will be many who follow them.

original: khyim pa'i tshul khrims 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyim pa'i tshul khrims 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will be like householders.

original: 'od srung / de'i dus na de lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srung / de'i dus na de lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Kāśyapa, at that time, such things will occur.

original: de la don tshol zhing byang chub yongs su tshol bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: de la don tshol zhing byang chub yongs su tshol bar 'dod pas /
translated: Those who seek the meaning and wish to seek enlightenment

original: dge slong ma dang 'dre bar mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong ma dang 'dre bar mi bya /
translated: should not associate with nuns.

original: de ltar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not live like that.

original: 'dre ba thams cad rnam pa thams cad du spangs la mi 'dre bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dre ba thams cad rnam pa thams cad du spangs la mi 'dre bar bya'o //
translated: They should abandon all associations in every way and not associate.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing thams cad rnam pa thams cad du spangs la bsod snyoms spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing thams cad rnam pa thams cad du spangs la bsod snyoms spyad par bya'o //
translated: They should abandon all worldly material things in every way and practice mendicancy.

original: gos la sred pa thams cad spangs la phyag dar khrod par bya'o //
analyzed: gos la sred pa thams cad spangs la phyag dar khrod par bya'o //
translated: They should abandon all craving for clothes and wear rags.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa dang / gding ba thams cad rnam pa thams @21b cad du spangs la /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa dang / gding ba thams cad rnam pa thams @21b cad du spangs la /
translated: They should abandon all multi-storied buildings and bedding in every way.

original: chu 'gram dang / mya ngam la brten par bya /
analyzed: chu 'gram dang / mya ngam la brten par bya /
translated: They should rely on river banks and desolate places.

original: rdo leb dang / shing drung du brten par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo leb dang / shing drung du brten par bya'o //
translated: They should rely on flat rocks and the foot of trees.

original: na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad thams cad spangs la bkus te bor ba la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad thams cad spangs la bkus te bor ba la brten par bya'o //
translated: They should abandon all medicines and provisions for the sick and rely on what is discarded.

original: sems can thams cad sngon gyi snag gi gnyen mtshams su gyur par rig nas byams pa la gnas par bya /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sngon gyi snag gi gnyen mtshams su gyur par rig nas byams pa la gnas par bya /
translated: Having understood that all sentient beings have been your close relatives in the past, you should abide in loving kindness.

original: gshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang / yongs su gdung ba rnam pa thams cad du spangs la bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: gshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang / yongs su gdung ba rnam pa thams cad du spangs la bzod par bya'o //
translated: You should be patient, having completely given up on being angry, beating, and tormenting others.

original: mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong ba ster ba'i khyim thams cad spangs la las bdag gir bya ba la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong ba ster ba'i khyim thams cad spangs la las bdag gir bya ba la brten par bya'o //
translated: You should give up on all the homes of friends and benefactors, and rely on the fact that you are the owner of your own actions.

original: khyim pa dang 'dre bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang 'dre bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not associate with householders.

original: des ji skad du bstan pa'i so sor thar pa dang mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: des ji skad du bstan pa'i so sor thar pa dang mthun par bya'o //
translated: You should be in accord with the precepts of individual liberation as they have been taught.

original: 'od srung / gang dag so sor thar pa dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'od srung / gang dag so sor thar pa dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa de dag ni /
translated: Kāśyapa, those who think that they should not be in accord with the precepts of individual liberation

original: sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa'o //
translated: are thinking that they should not be in accord with the powers and fearlessnesses of the Buddha.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa de dag ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa ste /🔽de'i rnam par smin pas ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pas sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba'i tshor ba dag de'i tshor ba de'i brgya'i char yang mi phod /
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa de dag ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub dang mi mthun par bya bar sems pa ste / de'i rnam par smin pas ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pas sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba'i tshor ba dag de'i tshor ba de'i brgya'i char yang mi phod /
translated: Those who think they can oppose the powers and fearlessness of the Buddha are thinking they can oppose the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, present, and future.🔽The ripening of that [karma] is such that the amount of feeling of pain experienced by the beings of the great billionfold world system in the hells does not equal even a hundredth part of that feeling.

original: stong dang / brgya stong dang / bye ba brgya stong dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba @22a *//
analyzed: stong dang / brgya stong dang / bye ba brgya stong dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba @22a *//
translated: It does not equal even a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, a ten millionth, a billionth, a ten billionth, a trillionth, a quintillionth part of that feeling.🔽It does not equal any number, fraction, calculation,

original: dang; dpe dang / rgyur yang mi phod do //
analyzed: dang; dpe dang / rgyur yang mi phod do //
translated: example, or cause.

original: sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba 'di lta bu 'di dag yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba 'di lta bu 'di dag yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
translated: Those who wish to completely abandon such suffering and mental pain

original: dge slong de dag gi spyod pa 'di lta bu 'di dag dpag tshad stong bas kyang ring du yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gi spyod pa 'di lta bu 'di dag dpag tshad stong bas kyang ring du yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: “ ‘These monks’ conduct should be avoided from a distance of one thousand leagues.

original: bzlas pa'i sgra yang yongs su spang bar bya na /
analyzed: bzlas pa'i sgra yang yongs su spang bar bya na /
translated: One should avoid even hearing their voices.

original: blta ba dang / mnyan pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: blta ba dang / mnyan pa lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention seeing them or listening to them?

original: de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid them.

original: chos gcig kun tu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: chos gcig kun tu bstan par bya ste /
translated: “ ‘There is one teaching that should be taught:

original: chos gcig po gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gcig po gang zhe na /
translated: What is that one teaching?

original: chos thams cad dngos po med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med par gyur pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are devoid of substance.

original: gang gi tshe bdag kyang de 'dra ba'i tshe chos thams cad la dngos po med pa'i bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag kyang de 'dra ba'i tshe chos thams cad la dngos po med pa'i bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: When one has such an understanding, one will have the acceptance that all phenomena are devoid of substance.

original: de mi de lta bu de dag dang bsten par mi byed /🔽bsnyen par mi byed /
analyzed: de mi de lta bu de dag dang bsten par mi byed / bsnyen par mi byed /
translated: One should not associate with such people.🔽One should not serve them.

original: bsnyen bkur mi byed do //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur mi byed do //
translated: One should not honor them.

original: des chos gnyis kun du bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: des chos gnyis kun du bsten par bya ste /
translated: “ ‘There are two teachings that should be followed:

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are those two?

original: chos thams cad la dngos po med pa'i chos nyid yongs su btsal bar bya ba dang / yongs su btsal ba'i sems kyang bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dngos po med pa'i chos nyid yongs su btsal bar bya ba dang / yongs su btsal ba'i sems kyang bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: He should investigate the ultimate reality of all phenomena, which is non-substantial, and he should not even arouse the thought of investigating.

original: ji lta bur yongs su btsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur yongs su btsal bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should he investigate?

original: ji ltar yongs su btsal ba de gnyis mi dmigs par 'gyur ba lta bur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su btsal ba de gnyis mi dmigs par 'gyur ba lta bur ro //
translated: As he investigates, he should not apprehend either of the two.

original: de la mi dmigs pas mi dmigs pa'i sems kyang bskyed par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pas mi dmigs pa'i sems kyang bskyed par mi bya ste /
translated: And by not apprehending, he should not even arouse the thought of not apprehending.

original: de ni log par lta ba yin pas khams gsum pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni log par lta ba yin pas khams gsum pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: That is a wrong view, and so he should follow the bodhisattva way of life with a mind free from the three realms.

original: mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i sems kyis byang chub @22b sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i sems kyis byang chub @22b sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: He should follow the bodhisattva way of life with a mind free from all signs.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the bodhisattva way of life:

original: gang 'di de'i dus na bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'di de'i dus na bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught at that time.

original: gang dag chos 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas yongs su spong bas yongs su spong pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa mnyes par byas nas /🔽mi mnyes par mi byed /
analyzed: gang dag chos 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas yongs su spong bas yongs su spong pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa mnyes par byas nas / mi mnyes par mi byed /
translated: will please the Tathāgata Maitreya,🔽and will not displease him.

original: thugs byung bar mi byed pas /
analyzed: thugs byung bar mi byed pas /
translated: They will not displease him,

original: kye ma'o bdag cag bdud kyi zhags pa dag las grol lo //
analyzed: kye ma'o bdag cag bdud kyi zhags pa dag las grol lo //
translated: and so they will be free from the bonds of Māra.

original: kye ma bdag cag ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams las grol te /
analyzed: kye ma bdag cag ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams las grol te /
translated: They will be free from the causes for going to the lower realms.

original: kye ma bde'o zhes tshig tu smra'o //
analyzed: kye ma bde'o zhes tshig tu smra'o //
translated: They will say, ‘Ah! We are happy!’

original: 'od srung / gang dag de'i dus na mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'od srung / gang dag de'i dus na mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Kāśyapa, those who, at that time, hear such sūtras as these, and are not frightened, terrified, or scared,

original: de la bdag kyang rjes su mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la bdag kyang rjes su mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and who see themselves as following them,

original: gzungs kyi blo yang skye bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi blo yang skye bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen te /
translated: and who develop the mind of dhāraṇī—all of them will be known by the Tathāgata.

original: de dag thams cad nga'i chos srung ba dag go /
analyzed: de dag thams cad nga'i chos srung ba dag go /
translated: All of them will be my Dharma protectors.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / khyim bdag phyug po nor che ba longs spyod che ba zhig gi bu gang yin pa de dag gis khyim de nas tha na pha'i rdzas las chu rdza tsam mthong na yang mthong ma thag tu pha'i rdzas de la 'di ni bdag gi'o snyam du 'du shes bskyed
analyzed: dper na / khyim bdag phyug po nor che ba longs spyod che ba zhig gi bu gang yin pa de dag gis khyim de nas tha na pha'i rdzas las chu rdza tsam mthong na yang mthong ma thag tu pha'i rdzas de la 'di ni bdag gi'o snyam du 'du shes bskyed
translated: if they see even a single water pot in the house, upon seeing it they will think, ‘This is my father’s property.’

original: de / dus gzhan zhig na pha yang shi la longs spyod kyang zad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de / dus gzhan zhig na pha yang shi la longs spyod kyang zad pa'i tshe /
translated: Later, when the father has died and the wealth is exhausted,

original: chu rdza de bdag gi drung du 'jog gam /
analyzed: chu rdza de bdag gi drung du 'jog gam /
translated: will they place that water pot in front of themselves?

original: gnas gang yang rung bar 'jog pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gnas gang yang rung bar 'jog pa de bzhin du /
translated: Or will they place it in some other location?

original: 'od srung / de'i dus na dge slong de dag mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos na /🔽'di lta bu'i 'du shes yid la byed pa @23a *//
analyzed: 'od srung / de'i dus na dge slong de dag mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos na / 'di lta bu'i 'du shes yid la byed pa @23a *//
translated: Kāśyapa, at that time, if those bhikṣus hear these kinds of sūtras,🔽they will give rise to this kind of perception and attention,

original: bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: thinking,

original: mdo sde 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa mdzes pa yid du 'ong bas gsungs pa'o snyam mo //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa mdzes pa yid du 'ong bas gsungs pa'o snyam mo //
translated: ‘These sūtras were spoken by the Tathāgata, beautifully and delightfully.’

original: de la dge slong kha cig ni /
analyzed: de la dge slong kha cig ni /
translated: Among them, some bhikṣus

original: mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos na spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos na spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they hear such sūtras as this, they will abandon them.

original: de la chos 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag ni 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la chos 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag ni 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: “The bhikṣus who uphold the Dharma will think,

original: mdo sde 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //🔽snyam du sems la /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o // snyam du sems la /
translated: ‘These sūtras were spoken by the Tathāgata.’

original: kha cig gis brnyas shing shin tu brnyas pa gyur pa de dag ni nyung la nyam chung par gyur pa dag ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis brnyas shing shin tu brnyas pa gyur pa de dag ni nyung la nyam chung par gyur pa dag ste /
translated: “But some will disparage and utterly despise them. They will be few and weak.

original: de dag gis sba ba'i phyir nyin mtshan du 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sba ba'i phyir nyin mtshan du 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to conceal them, they will be hidden day and night.

original: 'od srung; 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa dang / nga'i chos kyi grong khyer bsrung bar 'gyur ba tha mal pa de dag ni nyung ste /
analyzed: 'od srung; 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa dang / nga'i chos kyi grong khyer bsrung bar 'gyur ba tha mal pa de dag ni nyung ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, it is like this: the Tathāgata Maitreya and I will protect the city of the Dharma. Those who are ordinary will be few.

original: de dag ngas da ltar gzigs so //
analyzed: de dag ngas da ltar gzigs so //
translated: I see them now.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen po ni 'di dag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen po ni 'di dag ste /
translated: Therefore, these are their antidotes.

original: de dag ni sbyin pa chen po yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sbyin pa chen po yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //

original: khyed za ma tog lta bu'i chos la kun du spyod pa mang bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyed za ma tog lta bu'i chos la kun du spyod pa mang bar ma byed cig /
translated: Do not engage in the Dharma of the closed fist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: chos 'di dag ni snying stobs bskyed pa yin @36a *//🔽pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni snying stobs bskyed pa yin @36a *// pa'i phyir te /
translated: These teachings are for generating courage.

original: khyed g-yo ba ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyed g-yo ba ma byed cig /
translated: Do not be fickle.

original: chos 'di dag ni snying stobs bskyed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni snying stobs bskyed pa yin gyi /
translated: These teachings are for generating courage.

original: khyed khro ba la gdu bar ma byed cig /🔽khyod dngos po len par ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyed khro ba la gdu bar ma byed cig / khyod dngos po len par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not be angry.🔽Do not grasp at things.

original: khyed dngos po med par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed dngos po med par gyis shig /
translated: Do not be attached to things.

original: khyed mtshan ma'i 'du shes ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyed mtshan ma'i 'du shes ma byed cig /
translated: Do not be attached to the perception of signs.

original: khyed gnas med pa dang 'dris pa med par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed gnas med pa dang 'dris pa med par gyis shig /
translated: Do not be attached to a place or to familiarity.

original: khyed ba lang dang / bong bu sdud par ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyed ba lang dang / bong bu sdud par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not be attached to cattle or donkeys.

original: khyed le lo'i gnas rnams dang ldan par ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyed le lo'i gnas rnams dang ldan par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not be attached to the abode of laziness.

original: khyed mi dge ba'i chos spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /
analyzed: khyed mi dge ba'i chos spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /
translated: Strive to abandon nonvirtue and to accomplish virtue.

original: 'od srung / ngas ni rnam grangs du mas dben pa bsngags te /
analyzed: 'od srung / ngas ni rnam grangs du mas dben pa bsngags te /
translated: Kāśyapa, I have praised solitude in many ways,

original: dgon pa la gnas pa dang / 'du 'dzi med pa bsngags so //
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa dang / 'du 'dzi med pa bsngags so //
translated: and I have praised living in the wilderness and being free from busyness.

original: de la yo byad ma bsnyungs pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: de la yo byad ma bsnyungs pa la gnas pa /
translated: As for not being miserly with material things,

original: 'dod pa che ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa che ba /
translated: They are greedy,

original: sdig pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: sdig pa 'dod pa /
translated: they are greedy for sin,

original: yo byad ma bsnyungs pa'i tshul la gnas pa dag gis yo byad bsnyungs pa la gnas pa 'di lta bu 'di dag spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yo byad ma bsnyungs pa'i tshul la gnas pa dag gis yo byad bsnyungs pa la gnas pa 'di lta bu 'di dag spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they are not content with their possessions.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / dbyar zla 'bring po la mi zhig mar 'thungs la /
analyzed: dper na / dbyar zla 'bring po la mi zhig mar 'thungs la /
translated: In the middle of summer a man drinks some sesame oil,

original: de yang shes rab 'chal pa'i rang bzhin can zhig pas skom nas chu tshol te /
analyzed: de yang shes rab 'chal pa'i rang bzhin can zhig pas skom nas chu tshol te /
translated: and because he is of a foolish nature, he becomes thirsty.🔽He asks someone for water,

original: des mi zhig la chu bslangs pa dang / des 'di skad du kye mi khyod mar 'thungs kyi chu 'dod par ma byed cig /
analyzed: des mi zhig la chu bslangs pa dang / des 'di skad du kye mi khyod mar 'thungs kyi chu 'dod par ma byed cig /
translated: and the other person says to him, ‘Hey, you! You have drunk sesame oil, so do not ask for water!🔽You will die!’

original: shi bar gyur ta re zhes smras pa dang / de khor bas zil gyis non nas mi de la mi snyan par brjod cing gshe la /
analyzed: shi bar gyur ta re zhes smras pa dang / de khor bas zil gyis non nas mi de la mi snyan par brjod cing gshe la /
translated: But he is overcome by thirst and he scolds and insults that person.

original: de'i tshig ma mnyan te /
analyzed: de'i tshig ma mnyan te /
translated: He does not listen to his words,

original: des chu 'thungs nas @36b 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: des chu 'thungs nas @36b 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: and he drinks the water and dies.

original: 'od srung / gang dag dmigs pa can gyi rang bzhin can brkam pa /
analyzed: 'od srung / gang dag dmigs pa can gyi rang bzhin can brkam pa /
translated: “Kāśyapa, those who are of a greedy nature, who are focused on objects,

original: yon tan ma yin pa la gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa la gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There will be monks who are not virtuous.

original: de dag la chos 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'i dge slong dag gis 'di ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la chos 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'i dge slong dag gis 'di ni bya ba'o //
translated: When monks who uphold the Dharma admonish them, saying, ‘This is to be done.

original: 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bskul na /
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bskul na /
translated: This is not to be done,’

original: de dag khro bos zil gyis non nas /
analyzed: de dag khro bos zil gyis non nas /
translated: they will be overcome by anger.

original: mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / gshe bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / gshe bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will speak unpleasantly and be abusive.

original: mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will reject sūtras such as this and the instructions and teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: 'od srung / de lta bas na da ltar phal cher de bzhin gshegs pa dang rtsod do //
analyzed: 'od srung / de lta bas na da ltar phal cher de bzhin gshegs pa dang rtsod do //
translated: “Kāśyapa, therefore, they will mostly dispute with the Tathāgata.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' zhing stan gcig par za ba bsngags pa na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' zhing stan gcig par za ba bsngags pa na /
translated: Kāśyapa, when the Tathāgata established the basis of training for the community of monks and praised eating in one place,

original: dge slong bzang skyong khro bas zil gyis non nas zla ba gsum na nga'i gan du 'ongs pa la ltos /
analyzed: dge slong bzang skyong khro bas zil gyis non nas zla ba gsum na nga'i gan du 'ongs pa la ltos /
translated: look how the monk Bhadrapāla, overcome by anger, came to me after three months.

original: 'od srung / tshangs par spyod pa'i snying po mchog 'di nyid la gnas skabs 'di lta bu 'di byung na /
analyzed: 'od srung / tshangs par spyod pa'i snying po mchog 'di nyid la gnas skabs 'di lta bu 'di byung na /
translated: Kāśyapa, when this essence of pure conduct, this supreme essence, arises in this way,🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lta ci smos /🔽dge slong zang zing la chags pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lta ci smos / dge slong zang zing la chags pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, if this is the case even when I am present, what need is there to speak of after the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa?

original: lhung bzed la chags pa /
analyzed: lhung bzed la chags pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, there are monks who are attached to material things,🔽attached to their alms bowls,

original: chos gos la chags pa /
analyzed: chos gos la chags pa /
translated: attached to their robes,

original: na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad la chags pa /
analyzed: na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad la chags pa /
translated: attached to their medicine and provisions,

original: rmugs dang gnyid kyi dbang du song ba dang / gnod sems la dpa' ba'i dge slong rnams mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos na /
analyzed: rmugs dang gnyid kyi dbang du song ba dang / gnod sems la dpa' ba'i dge slong rnams mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos na /
translated: overcome by drowsiness and sleep, and who are intent on malice. If such monks hear these kinds of sūtras,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang bsti stang med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang bsti stang med par 'gyur na /
translated: they will not respect the Tathāgata,

original: dge slong gang dag bya ba la gnas pa rnams la lta @37a *//🔽ci smos / 'od srung /🔽gang chos rin po che 'di lta bu 'di nub par 'gyur ba ni ma legs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang dag bya ba la gnas pa rnams la lta @37a *// ci smos / 'od srung / gang chos rin po che 'di lta bu 'di nub par 'gyur ba ni ma legs pa'o //
translated: let alone those monks who are engaged in practice.

original: shin tu ma legs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu ma legs pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, it is not good, it is not at all good, that such precious Dharma as this should disappear.

original: de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo don 'dod pa /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo don 'dod pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, those sons or daughters of good family who desire the Dharma

original: dad pas phyi ma'i dus /🔽snyigs ma'i dus /
analyzed: dad pas phyi ma'i dus / snyigs ma'i dus /
translated: In the future,🔽in the degenerate age,

original: shin tu 'chab pa'i dus /
analyzed: shin tu 'chab pa'i dus /
translated: in the age of great concealment,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: son of noble family,

original: mu ge byung ba'i dus de na /
analyzed: mu ge byung ba'i dus de na /
translated: in that time of famine,

original: nga'i bstan pa la mdo sde zab mo 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas rigs pa dang ldan pa rnams la brjod par bya'o /
analyzed: nga'i bstan pa la mdo sde zab mo 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas rigs pa dang ldan pa rnams la brjod par bya'o /
translated: having heard these profound sūtras in my teachings, they should be explained to those who are reasonable.

original: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: They should not be explained to those who are unreasonable.

original: dad pa rnams la brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: dad pa rnams la brjod par bya'i /
translated: They should be explained to those with faith,

original: ma dad pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to those without faith.

original: 'od srung / nga yang da ltar rigs pa dang ldan pa rnams la ni smra'i /
analyzed: 'od srung / nga yang da ltar rigs pa dang ldan pa rnams la ni smra'i /
translated: Kāśyapa, I also now speak to those who are reasonable,

original: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to those who are unreasonable.

original: dad pa rnams la smra'i /
analyzed: dad pa rnams la smra'i /
translated: I speak to those with faith,

original: ma dad pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to those without faith.

original: 'od srung / rta rmu rgod ni rta cang shes kyi go cha mi len to //
analyzed: 'od srung / rta rmu rgod ni rta cang shes kyi go cha mi len to //
translated: Kāśyapa, a wild horse does not take on the harness of a thoroughbred.

original: len na yang de la de yid mi dga' bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: len na yang de la de yid mi dga' bar 'gyur na /
translated: Even if it does take it on, it will be unhappy with it.

original: dung dang / 'khar rnga dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga'i sgra bzod pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dung dang / 'khar rnga dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga'i sgra bzod pa lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to speak of the sounds of conches, kettledrums, and bherī drums?

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong tshul khrims 'chal ba yang skyes bu dam pa'i chos la nam yang bzod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong tshul khrims 'chal ba yang skyes bu dam pa'i chos la nam yang bzod par mi 'gyur /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, a monk with faulty discipline will never be patient with the Dharma of the noble beings.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste; dper na /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste; dper na /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: rta rmu rgod de ni 'drog par 'gyur ro //🔽'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong tshul khrims 'chal ba yang tha na chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes tshig gcig smras na /
analyzed: rta rmu rgod de ni 'drog par 'gyur ro // 'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong tshul khrims 'chal ba yang tha na chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes tshig gcig smras na /
translated: a wild horse will be frightened.🔽Kāśyapa, in the same way, a monk with faulty discipline will be frightened and terrified

original: de @37b la bdag gi 'du shes can 'jigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de @37b la bdag gi 'du shes can 'jigs par 'gyur /
translated: if he hears even a single word such as ‘all phenomena are selfless.’

original: skrag par 'gyur /🔽rtsod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: skrag par 'gyur / rtsod par 'gyur na /
translated: He will argue

original: nye bar bstan pa na lta ci smos /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa na lta ci smos /
translated: if he is taught, what need is there to speak of [his reaction] if he is fully instructed?

original: go cha bgos nas bdud kyi sde bye ba phrag brgya pham par bya /
analyzed: go cha bgos nas bdud kyi sde bye ba phrag brgya pham par bya /
translated: Having donned the armor, he should defeat the hordes of Māra.

original: ji ltar shin tu rtsod par mi 'gyur ba de ltar pha rol pham par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu rtsod par mi 'gyur ba de ltar pha rol pham par bya'o //
translated: He should defeat the opponent in such a way that there is no dispute at all.

original: de dag gis go cha de ni mi shigs pa'i rtsa ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i rtsa ba dang / ma chags pa'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang med pa'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug med pa'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: de dag gis go cha de ni mi shigs pa'i rtsa ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i rtsa ba dang / ma chags pa'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang med pa'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug med pa'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: It is the root of indestructibility, the root of the ascetic practices, the root of the fewness of desires, the root of non-attachment, the root of non-aversion, the root of non-delusion,🔽the root of non-envy, the root of the abandonment of desire, the root of dwelling alone, and the root of not sleeping.

original: phrag dog med pa'i rtsa ba dang / 'dod pa spong ba'i rtsa ba dang / gcig pu gnas pa'i rtsa ba dang / mi nyal ba'i rtsa ba'o; ;thams cad kyi thams cad du gnod sems kyi sems bskyed par mi bya /
analyzed: phrag dog med pa'i rtsa ba dang / 'dod pa spong ba'i rtsa ba dang / gcig pu gnas pa'i rtsa ba dang / mi nyal ba'i rtsa ba'o; ;thams cad kyi thams cad du gnod sems kyi sems bskyed par mi bya /
translated: One should not arouse thoughts of malice at all,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dod chags kyi sems bskyed par mi bya /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dod chags kyi sems bskyed par mi bya /
translated: nor should one arouse thoughts of desire at all.

original: gang du yang re bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang du yang re bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not hope for anything.

original: go cha de ni re ba med pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: go cha de ni re ba med pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That armor is called the root of non-hope.

original: go cha de lta bu de bgos nas /
analyzed: go cha de lta bu de bgos nas /
translated: Having donned that kind of armor,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya /
translated: one should arouse the mind of enlightenment.

original: gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med par bya'o //
translated: One should not cling to anything at all.

original: bdag tu 'du shes bskyed par mi bya ste /🔽sems can du 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes bskyed par mi bya ste / sems can du 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of self.🔽One should not give rise to the notion of a sentient being.

original: srog tu 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: srog tu 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of a living being.

original: gang zag tu 'du shes mi bskyed /🔽bud med du 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: gang zag tu 'du shes mi bskyed / bud med du 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of a person.🔽One should not give rise to the notion of a woman.

original: skyes par 'du shes mi bskyed /🔽sa'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: skyes par 'du shes mi bskyed / sa'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of a man.🔽One should not give rise to the notion of the earth element.

original: chu'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: chu'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of the water element.

original: me'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: me'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of the fire element.

original: rlung gi khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: rlung gi khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of the wind element.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /🔽gzugs @38a *// kyi khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed / gzugs @38a *// kyi khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of the desire realm.🔽One should not give rise to the notion of the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed /🔽tshul khrims su 'du shes mi bskyed /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'du shes mi bskyed / tshul khrims su 'du shes mi bskyed /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of the formless realm.🔽One should not give rise to the notion of moral discipline.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims su 'du shes mi bskyed cing /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims su 'du shes mi bskyed cing /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of immorality.

original: stong pa nyid du 'du shes bskyed par mi bya /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du 'du shes bskyed par mi bya /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of emptiness.

original: thams cad la 'du shes bskyed par mi bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad la 'du shes bskyed par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not give rise to the notion of anything at all.

original: tha na mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes kyang bskyed par mi bya na; bdag tu 'du shes bskyed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: tha na mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes kyang bskyed par mi bya na; bdag tu 'du shes bskyed pa lta ci smos /
translated: They should not even give rise to the idea of nirvāṇa, let alone the idea of a self.

original: ci'i phyir 'du shes bskyed par mi bya zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'du shes bskyed par mi bya zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why should they not give rise to any ideas?

original: 'di la 'du shes de dag gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la 'du shes de dag gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not apprehend any of those ideas.

original: 'od srung / gal te 'dod chags yang dag pa yin du zin na /
analyzed: 'od srung / gal te 'dod chags yang dag pa yin du zin na /
translated: Kāśyapa, if desire were real,

original: de'i 'pho ba dang 'gog pa kun du shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'pho ba dang 'gog pa kun du shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: its arising and cessation would not be known.

original: 'od srung / 'di ltar 'dod chags ni yul na gnas pa dang / phyogs na gnas par mi gnas te /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ltar 'dod chags ni yul na gnas pa dang / phyogs na gnas par mi gnas te /
translated: Kāśyapa, desire does not exist in a place or a direction.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for lying.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag par gsung ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag par gsung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata speaks the truth.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsung ngo //
translated: He speaks the truth as it is.

original: 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: Desire is not the self.

original: de lta bu'i chos de dag ni dge sbyong gi chos rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos de dag ni dge sbyong gi chos rnams so //
translated: Such dharmas are the dharmas of a mendicant.

original: de la gang mi dmigs pa de dag ni dge sbyong gi chos yin no //
analyzed: de la gang mi dmigs pa de dag ni dge sbyong gi chos yin no //
translated: Those who do not apprehend anything are spiritual practitioners.

original: gang dag gis 'du shes de bzung na /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'du shes de bzung na /
translated: Those who apprehend that notion

original: de dag gis ri rab dang mnyam pa'i gang zag tu 'du shes bzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ri rab dang mnyam pa'i gang zag tu 'du shes bzung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya'o snyam pa ni rlom sems so //
